    340,000 people have fled the violence into neighboring Uganda.
*   The UN says 
    200,000 people have fled Syria in 2016.
*   On average, another 2,500 South Sudanese become refugees.
*   Uganda is coping extremely well with the huge influx of refugees.
*   Uganda is beginning to struggle with its generous approach.

McKenzie, 38, will fight Jahmaine Smyle at York Hall on 12 November for the English super-middleweight championship. McKenzie became a professional boxer in 2013. He has a record of eight wins and one draw from his nine fights. McKenzie is the son of former British and European champion Clinton and is trained by his uncle, former three-time world champion Duke McKenzie.

The money for Bridgwater Community Hospital is part of the coalition's £330m investment for new NHS facilities across England. The new hospital will have 30 inpatient beds, a midwifery-led maternity unit, a minor injury unit and X-ray and space for mobile scanners. The current hospital was built in 1813. The total cost of the project is £33m and the remaining balance will be paid for by NHS Somerset and Somerset Partnership NHS Foundation Trust. In the past five years, three out of Somerset's 13 community hospitals have been replaced. Somerset PCT hopes to build the new hospital on land at Bowers Lane, which will depend on planning permission. The aim is to get the hospital finished by autumn 2014.

A man was fatally injured outside a property on Daniel Hill Terrace, Upperthorpe, close to the city centre. The man was found with a gunshot wound to his chest. The victim was taken to Northern General hospital but died from his injuries. There have been a number of shootings in Sheffield in recent weeks.

The Ukrainian Cyber Troops, Cyber Berkut, and Anonymous International are all virtual warriors. The Ukrainian Cyber Troops are led by Y.
Dokukin, a Kiev-
 based programmer. The Ukrainian Cyber Troops make extensive use of distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attack. The Cyber Troops have also hacked into public CCTV systems in rebel-held areas of eastern Ukraine. Cyber Berkut's goal is to thwart Ukraine's military plans. Cyber Berkific.

Tricia Marwick was visibly emotional after Duncan McNeil and Alex Salmond bid farewell to the parliament. Ms. Marwick, Mr. Salmond, and Mr. McNeil are among those standing down as MSPs ahead of the election on 5 May. Mr. Salmond served as first minister between 2007 and 2014. Annabel Goldie is also bowing out of Holyrood.

The Older People's Commissioner for Wales, Sarah Rochira, will gather experiences of residential care from pensioners, their friends, and families to develop recommendations for care providers and public bodies. This is part of her review into the quality of life and care of older people in residential care in Wales. The review will consider factors such as physical and psychological health, social relationships, and the care home environment. The commissioner's team will also speak to care providers, social care staff, and public bodies.

Harbro Group's pre-tax profit increased by £800,000, to £3.5m, in the year to the end of June 2016. Turnover fell by £1m to just over £100m. International sales grew over the year. The company manufactures and supplies feeds for the beef, sheep, dairy, pig and poultry sectors. It also has a network of 19 shops across Scotland, operating under the Country Store brand.

A man in his 70s was found dead at a house in Little Gaddesden. A man in his 80s was taken to the hospital. Detectives want to question 55-year-old Ian John McLoughlin, also known as Ian John Baker, in connection with the death, which is being treated as murder. McLoughlin is described as white, about 6ft tall, with straight, greying, collar-length hair and of average build. He is believed to have been wearing sunglasses, blue jeans or three-quarter length trousers and a dark blue, light blue and white checked short-sleeved shirt with a button-down collar.

David Lipton, second in command at the IMF, said the IMF's latest reading of the global economy shows a weakening baseline. The IMF is likely to downgrade its current forecast of 3.4% for global growth when it next releases its economic predictions in April.

The crossing at Cowes would be free until 2 July "in recognition of the problems" and to allow feedback. The council had ordered a review of the project by auditors. Since launching late on 14 May the chain ferry has broken down, run aground and been suspended due to "training issues". Cars have also been damaged getting on and off. Compensation was up for discussion. The council authorised the manufacture of ramp extensions to resolve the problem of vehicles scraping the concrete. Groundings were an issue with seamanship, which had been resolved.

A crash involving several vehicles happened on the southbound carriageway near the Hindhead tunnel at Bramshott at about 07:30 GMT on Thursday. A 32-year-old man was pronounced dead at the scene. A 33-year-old man from Waterlooville had been arrested on suspicion of causing death by driving without due care and attention. The road was closed between Thursley and Liphook until early evening.

Matching Models, an international temp agency, advertised for a personal assistant with a "classic look, brown long hair with b-c cup". The Equality and Human Rights Commission (EHRC) called it "appalling, unlawful and demeaning to women". Another job advert asked for a "sexy female driver". An employment lawyer said the advert was "clearly unlawful". The agency's founder said "looks are important". Under the 2010 Equality Act, it is against the law to discriminate against anyone.

The shooting occurred at a hostel attached to the private Pragati Residential School in Bangalore city. The alleged gunman, Mahesh, was working as an office assistant in the school. Mahesh is alleged to have shot 18-year-old Gautami and another student, Sirisha. Mahesh was arrested on Wednesday.

Glaad analyzed shows between June 2016 and May 2017 and counted 278 regular and recurring LGBT characters. The number of transgender characters has risen from seven to 16 this year. More than 25 lesbian and bisexual female characters died or were killed off. The report found a record high percentage of black characters on broadcast television. Glaad's Where We Are on TV study based its findings on scripted broadcast, cable and streaming series.

David Mackintosh, Conservative MP for Northampton South, announced his decision ahead of a local party meeting where his candidacy was expected to be opposed. Millions of pounds of public money loaned to Northampton Town FC appeared to have vanished. Mr. Mackintosh was criticized over the loan to Northampton Town Football Club from the borough council to rebuild Sixfields stadium and develop nearby land. About £10.25m of that money is now missing and the loan is subject to a police investigation into "alleged financial irregularities". Mr. Mackintosh said: "It has been a huge honour to be the member of Parliament since 2015, but I now feel it is the right time for my constituents to have a new representative."

Roy Oliver, 37, fired a rifle into a car, killing Jordan Edwards, 15. The death occurred when police responded to reports of underage drinking at a house party. Roy Oliver was charged with murder and four counts of aggravated assault with a deadly weapon. He faces five to 99 years in prison on the murder charge. He is currently free on bail.

The president-elect has said Mrs. Trump and Barron will move to Washington "very soon, after he's finished with school". There are only two other First Ladies in the history of the United States who have not made the White House their home during their husbands' years as commander-chief. The first lady occupies a very public role. The role of the first lady is only ceremonial.

A 72-year-old man was found dead at a sheltered housing complex in Inverness. The Police Investigations and Review Commissioner (Pirc), Kate Frame, has been asked to scrutinise the initial police response to the man's call. The Crown Office and Procurator Fiscal Service (COPFS) has instructed the Police Investigations and Review Commissioner to undertake an investigation into the initial police response. A report on the commissioner's findings will be submitted to the COPFS in due course.

A yellow warning of wind was issued, saying gusts of up to 75mph (120kmph) could occur locally, particularly to the west of the mountains. The unusual easterly direction could add to the impact of the winds. Disruption to travel on roads and at sea was likely. The affected counties are Conwy, Anglesey, Gwynedd, Pembrokeshire, Carmarthenshire, Ceredigion and Powys. A tree fell in Menai Bridge on Anglesey, closing Telford Road.

The Giants got a short-handed opener, but Jeff Dimmen pulled the Panthers level. Mike Forney's powerplay breakaway goal made it 2-1 with Andy Bohmback equalising. Mike Radja scored from an acute angle and James Desmarais made it 4-2 before Nottingham's David Ling got one back. The teams meet again on Saturday night. Nottingham lead the league on 28 points, with Sheffield Steelers on 27 and Belfast 25.

Hamilton started from the back, had a broken front wing on lap one, and did five pit stops. Vettel came second despite colliding with team-mate Raikkonen on the first lap. Ricciardo took the lead from Rosberg at the first corner. Rosberg won the race.

Thomas Hitzlsperger revealed his homosexuality to advance discussion of a topic that was "simply ignored" in German football. His former team-mates and leading figures in German football administration praised his announcement. Hitzlsperger's announcement is seen as a watershed moment in Germany, which like England has struggled with the problem of homophobia in football.

Sidwell, 34, has made 32 Championship appearances this season to help the Seagulls achieve promotion to the top flight for the first time in 34 years. With his contract due to expire at the end of the campaign, the midfielder is now hoping to sign a new deal. Sidwell made 19 appearances for Albion on loan from Stoke during 2015-16 before signing a one-year deal with Brighton in June 2016. He has previously played in the Premier League with Reading, Chelsea, Aston Villa, Fulham and Stoke.
Blackpool and Colchester United tied 1-1. Jamille Matt scored for Blackpool, and Kurtis Guthrie scored for Colchester United. Sean Murray of Colchester United received a red card.

The 29-year-old made 37 appearances for the Sky Blues last season as they were relegated from League One. Reid could make his debut for the U's in Wednesday's EFL Cup first-round tie against Championship side Aston Villa. Colchester started the season with a 3-1 defeat at Accrington on Saturday.

PC Keith Palmer's murder prompted a greater emphasis on the need for a permanent memorial. The UK Police Memorial Trust appealed for £1.5m towards its construction at the National Memorial Arboretum. It is set to bear the names of more than 1,400 officers and staff. The memorial will be dedicated to the courage and sacrifice of the officers, who have lost their lives over the past 250 years. The government had committed £1m towards the £4m needed for it. The memorial is expected to be completed by 2019.

United remain 15 points clear at the top of the table with eight games left after a 1-0 win at Sunderland. The next league game is the derby against Manchester City. Manchester United have won 50 of a possible 54 points in their last 18 Premier League games. Ferguson will make changes for Monday's FA Cup quarter-final replay at Chelsea after seeing Rafael and Anderson suffer injuries at Sunderland, while goalkeeper David De Gea also suffered a knock. There will be changes at Chelsea. Ryan Giggs and Javier Hernandez will be available.

Mr. Schmidt told the BBC that Google did what was "legally required" to pay the right amount of taxes. Google paid Â£10m in UK corporate taxes between 2006 and 2011. Margaret Hodge suggested a new committee should be established to oversee the tax arrangements of major firms. European Union leaders agreed to tackle tax avoidance through an "automatic information exchange between tax authorities" to monitor the situation.

NHS Improvement wants to reduce the £3.6bn spent on agency staff by £1bn by the end of this financial year. A cap was introduced in October and has saved £600m. Hospitals, mental health trusts and ambulance services should not be paying more than 55% above normal shift rates for any staff, except senior managers. NHS Improvement will start publishing "league tables" of the best and worst-performing trusts on agency spending later this year. Information on the 20 highest-earning agency staff per trust would also be collected.

The Longford Town Centre was a monument to the end of the Celtic Tiger and the Republic of Ireland's economic crash. Local traders believe the bad times are slowly changing. The main opposition party is highly critical of how the Fine Gael-Labour coalition is dealing with the midlands. The government says it is doing its bit for County Longford. Traders believe more could be done to boost local business. The message coming from the midlands is that while it, too, is starting to see the beginnings of an economic recovery more still needs to be done.

The competition finishes on 29 May. There are eight teams taking part, facing each other twice, with the top four sides qualifying for the play-offs. Four current or former England players will take part in the tournament: Eoin Morgan, Jos Buttler, Sam Billings, and Kevin Pietersen.

The number of plastic carrier bags has gone up by 200 million since 2013. From October, people in England will have to pay 5p for their plastic bags. Supermarkets in Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland have all seen a decrease in bags used.

A school roof was ripped off in Rhosgadfan, and hundreds of homes across Wales experienced power cuts. There were train delays, speed and lane restrictions on major bridges. Irish Ferries cancelled six of its fast sailings between Holyhead and Dublin. Arriva Trains Wales warned of "speed restrictions and possible delays" for all services between Llandudno Junction to Holyhead. The National Trust closed Erddig Hall and Chirk Castle in Wrexham. Rhyl's Boxing Day Dip in the sea in Denbighshire will now go ahead on Tuesday, 27 December.

Michael B. Jordan is "super excited" to be in the film and wants "to put a different spin on it". The film will see Jordan reunite with his Creed director Ryan Coogler. Jordan said he could not wait to work with Nyong'o and Chadwick Boseman. Black Panther will be released in February 2018.

The theatre, founded in 1875, will be used for theatrical performances, cinema screenings, comedy and live music. The BBC studios will also be repaired and refurbished. The theatre and studios form part of a larger east wing restoration project to transform Alexandra Palace into a new cultural destination. The glazed east court will become a space for the public and for exhibitions. Heritage Lottery Fund (HLF) is contributing £18.8m towards the project, while Haringey Council is contributing £6.8m. The entire east wing will be refurbished at a cost of £26.6m. Alexandra Park and Palace Charitable Trust have committed to raising the final £1m by summer 2017.

The former Manchester City man, 30, won 61 caps for England after making his senior debut in 2009. He was a squad member at two World Cups and two European Championships but played just three minutes at Euro 2016. Milner also holds the record for the most capped England Under-21 player, picking up 46 caps after making his first appearance in 2004. He scored his first, and only, international goal in England's 5-0 victory over Moldova at the 2014 Fifa World Cup qualifiers.

Marcy Smith and her family's house in Glovertown, Newfoundland and Labrador, was destroyed by a fire. The whole family escaped, but their dog and cats did not. The fire was started by rubbish burned in the wood stove. The fire alarm did not go off. The community has donated clothes, shoes, and a bike to the family.

An energy drinks company was considering a £200m offer for the Premier League club. Sullivan and Gold bought a majority stake in West Ham in 2010 in a deal that valued the club at £105m and now own more than 85% of the club. Since August's move to London Stadium, West Ham have also been linked with takeovers from Qatari and Chinese groups. Last year Sullivan said a minority shareholding could be sold to clear debts but that he and Gold intended the ownership to pass on to their children.

The night's big winner was The Fault in Our Stars, which won best movie. Shailene Woodley also picked up best female performance, the Trailblazer Award and best kiss for a scene with Ansel Elgort. Bradley Cooper won best male performance for his role as the late Chris Kyle in American Sniper. Channing Tatum took home best comedic performance for 22 Jump Street and Meryl Streep picked up best villain for her role in Into the Woods. Kevin Hart brought his kids on stage to accept the comedic genius award. Robert Downey Jr accepted the Generation Award.

Smith, 21, was loaned to United in July and has five goals this season. Smith made his Aberdeen debut in 2012 and has scored four times in 89 appearances. St Mirren's boss said Smith is a good player and will be a good fit. Championship bottom side St Mirren host Falkirk on Saturday.

Northumberland County Council said the weather was now warm enough for its Jetpatcher machines to tackle the holes. It is hoped that 145 potholes each day will be "filled in" over the next four months. Extra staff will also be out repairing drainage systems damaged by heavy rain and to clear debris from gutters.

In December, on EnQuest's Thistle platform off Shetland, Wood Group contractors were exposed to alpha radiation. EnQuest said "additional precautionary steps" had since been taken. The men were working 125 miles (201 km) north east of Shetland. The level of exposure was less than 1% of the level at which it is reportable to the Health and Safety Executive. Wood Group said it was committed to employee safety.

The Asian Civilisation Museum (ACM) bought the artwork for $650,000 (£420,000) from New York dealer Art of the Past in 2007. The company's manager later admitted selling stolen Indian antiquities, including the bronze being returned. The sculpture of Hindu goddess Uma Parameshvari is thought to have been stolen from a Shiva temple in Tamil Nadu in southern India. The decision to return the item came after discussions between Singapore's National Heritage Board and the Indian government body looking after its antiquities, the Archaeological Survey of India (ASI). The ASI submitted an official request for the return of the sculpture in May, according to the museum. ACM took note of the confession of Aaron Freedman, who was the manager of Art of the Past, of dealing in looted Indian antiquities and of criminal possession of 150 stolen objects. It was one of 30 objects ACM bought from the art dealer, although none of the others are thought to be listed as stolen. The museum said it will take legal action to get compensation for the apparent fraud.

A magnitude-4.8 quake struck 35km north of Lucca at a depth of 15.5km. The tremor was felt as far away as Milan and Florence. There were no immediate reports of injuries or damage. The quake struck at 15:48 (14:48 GMT), with its epicentre in Garfagnana. Several aftershocks were felt across a large area. Phone lines were down and power supplies were cut in the Garfagnana area. Schools were evacuated. The quake was also felt in Bologna and Modena. In Lucca, people went into the streets. Last May, two earthquakes in the same area left more than 20 people dead. Six scientists and an ex-official were convicted of multiple manslaughter in October 2012 for giving a falsely reassuring statement before the 2009 L'Aquila quake.
Austin Grant from Sheffield has seen some results. The fruit is still attached to the plant and is not yet ripe enough to eat. The 62-year-old grandfather said, "I was literally jumping for joy".

The game's release has been delayed until 24 March. The open world adventure was due to go on sale on 27 January. Online heists are coming to consoles before the PC release date. Screenshots from the PC version of GTA V have been released. Minimum specifications required to run GTA V have also been published. Grand Theft Auto V became the fastest-selling entertainment product ever when it was released on 17 September 2013, taking just three days to generate $1bn in revenue.

The 76-year-old received the Â£25,000 prize for Squint (19) at Liverpool's Walker Art Gallery. The judge said Squint (19) was "quite extraordinary". The work depicts a leper squint. The relatively small size of Squint (19) was one of the reasons Simpson entered it into the competition. The prize money would be spent on "stretches, canvas and - particularly - good quality paints". The John Moores Painting Prize is one of Britain's oldest art awards.

The offices of Yeni Safak and Yeni Akit were attacked. No casualties were reported. Four masked assailants attacked the Yeni Safak building. Firefighters extinguished the blaze. Police have cordoned off the area around the building. Windows in both buildings were shattered by gunfire. Numerous spent bullet casings were found at both scenes. Police are hunting the assailants. No group has claimed responsibility.

A 24-year-old player under contract with the Stags will join on a free transfer. He spent the first half of the season on loan at Crawley, scoring three goals in 23 appearances. The ex-Burton player will officially join on 1 January and becomes Bignot's first signing for the Mariners.

Wenger's contract runs to the summer. Southgate succeeded Sam Allardyce in September and oversaw England's 2-0 win against Malta as well the disappointing 0-0 draw with Slovenia on Tuesday. Southgate has a World Cup qualifier against Scotland at Wembley on 11 November and a friendly against Spain four days later. Wenger said 21-year-old defender Hector Bellerin would be offered a new contract by the club. Midfielder Aaron Ramsey, 25, will miss "one or two" more games.

A local man fell from a cherry picker at Fruehauf on Houghton Road at about 13:45 GMT on Thursday. Lincolnshire Police is carrying out a joint inquiry with the Health and Safety Executive. The company is cooperating fully with the investigation.

A new charter arrangement will end the row over seafarers' pay. The charter change will see contracted out services return to operator Serco Northlink from next month. The new arrangements would come into force early next month. All crew members will be paid at least the minimum wage. Serco Northlink was awarded the six-year Â£243m Northern Isles contract in 2012.

Ken Dickie died in hospital on 14 May, six days after an incident at the Rockley Park site in Poole. Jamie Mitchell admitted intervening in an argument between Mr. Dickie and his mother. Mr. Mitchell and his mother admitted attempting to pervert the course of justice by lying about the course of events. The pair will be sentenced on 6 February.

Rod Temperton died in London last week at the age of 66 after "a brief aggressive battle with cancer". Temperton's hits included Off The Wall and Baby Be Mine for Jackson and Boogie Nights for his band Heatwave. Temperton was nicknamed The Invisible Man because of his low profile. He traced his songwriting ability back to his father's influence. In the 1970s, he answered an advert in Melody Maker magazine for a keyboardist and joined the band Heatwave. He penned three songs for Off The Wall and three more for Thriller. Temperton won a Grammy Award in 1990 for his work on Birdland. He was nominated for two Oscars in 1986 for his work with Jones on the soundtrack for The Color Purple.

Dr. Neil Loader and Emeritus Prof. Alayne Street-Perrott, along with researchers from other universities, found ancient earthworks, possibly 2,000 years old, in the western Brazilian Amazon. The research investigated ditched enclosures, which led to the discovery of more than 450 large geometrical "geoglyphs". The function of these sites is still little understood, but they were possibly used as ritual gathering places. The research indicates a wide variety of plant species spread over 6,000 years, which could only have been artificially brought together by humans. The team likened it to a form of "prehistoric supermarket" of useful forest products.

The Australian, 21, beat world number 29 Querrey to progress to the second round. Kyrgios, ranked 12th in the world, won the Japan Open on Sunday. Kyrgios said he was feeling very tired. Kyrgios said his success in Japan, and the travelling involved in playing at the Qi Zhong Stadium, had taken its toll. Kyrgios was fined $1,500 for a foul-mouthed outburst at the Shanghai Masters last year.

The human papilloma virus (HPV) jab will protect people from head and neck cancers. HPV is sexually transmitted and girls aged 12 and 13 receive the vaccine to protect them against cervical cancer. The Welsh government is waiting for advice from the Joint Committee on Vaccination and Immunisation. Charities and organizations will deliver a letter to the Welsh government on Monday calling for the vaccination to be rolled out. The number of head and neck cancer cases are increasing. In 2008, a vaccination program was rolled out in schools and 85% of girls in Wales have been vaccinated. The Welsh government will await the committee's recommendations and will consider the implications for Wales of any proposed changes to the HPV vaccination program.

Jak Trueman, 15, had a rare form of blood cancer called gamma delta T-cell lymphoma. He briefly attended a school prom held in his honor on Saturday. His mother announced his death on his Facebook page. Since his diagnosis last August, Jak had been posting updates on a Facebook page called Jak's Journey. The Jak's Journey page attracted more than 28,000 Likes. On January 23, Jak and his family found out from doctors that his cancer had spread throughout his body and they decided to not pursue any other treatment. In the days after he received the news, Jak's family urged people to donate to a fundraising page for Leukaemia & Lymphoma Research. More money is expected to be raised for charity on Sunday at a special football match being held at the Energy Assets Arena, home of Livingston FC.

Egypt defeated Uganda  to win 1-0. The win means Egypt play Ghana on Wednesday with top spot of Group D still at stake. Uganda are out of their first tournament since 1978. Egypt will play Ghana on Wednesday.

Lancashire County Council has earmarked land on the former Glenburn Sports College and Skelmersdale College. Skelmersdale could get two direct trains to Liverpool per hour under the plans made in partnership with Merseytravel and West Lancashire Borough Council. The preferred location was big enough to allow for the possibility of future expansion. The authority confirmed it will now start the process of acquiring the relevant land. Skelmersdale was designated a new town on 9 October 1961.
Plants were found during a search of a warehouse near Ashbourne on Saturday morning. Police said they were in "an elaborate grow house". A man in his late 40s was arrested at the scene.

A 28-year-old woman was found with serious injuries and underwent an emergency operation. Police say she had been dragged by the neck through several streets. The woman's ex-partner, a 38-year-old man, handed himself in to authorities. Both the victim and the suspect are German citizens of Kurdish origin. The motive for the attack was not yet clear.

A study by the Cass Business School and the universities of Warwick and Wisconsin looked at 4,600 workers and found that women are as likely as men to ask for a pay rise, but are less likely to get one. When like-for-like male and female workers were compared, men were 25% more likely to get a pay rise when they asked. The study was based on data from the 2013-14 Australian workplace relations survey. The study also found differences according to age, with women and men under 40 both asking for and receiving pay rises at the same rate.

Oxford City Council has been searching for a new burial site for many years, but has not found a suitable location. The money had mostly been used for "ground investigations of possible sites". Two cemeteries still have space, in Wolvercote and Botley, but they are expected to be full by 2018 and 2021. After the two remaining cemeteries are full only the reopening of family plots, the use of a few reserved plots, and the interment of ashes would be possible. The last increase in burial space in Oxford was in 1932.

Visitors to the Hebridean Celtic Festival will be able to use an app to trigger online information from items such as signs and posters on the site. Videos and band interviews will be among the online material available to view on phones and tablets. HebCelt is taking place in Stornoway on the Isle of Lewis from 19 to 22 July. The Waterboys, Imelda May, Lucy Spraggan, Skerryvore, Peatbog Faeries and Dougie MacLean are among this year's acts.

A 10-year-old Irish-bred horse collapsed and died after winning the Cotswold Chase. The British Horseracing Authority confirmed the horse suffered from a "severe pulmonary haemorrhage". The horse had shown symptoms of post-race ataxia in the past, but had never collapsed before.

Davina, now 34, denied the charge of raping a 15-year-old girl in a Portsmouth garage in 2004. She will be sentenced on 4 March. Judge Ian Pearson remanded her into custody and said it was likely she would be held at a male prison. The court heard that Ayrton, who has learning difficulties, attempted to commit suicide last summer. The court heard that in 2014 Ayrton told a worker at the care home where she lived in Fordingbridge, Hampshire, about the attack.

The Serbs lost 6-4 6-4 to Brazilians Marcelo Melo and Bruno Soares in Rio. The loss came a day after Djokovic was knocked out of the singles by Argentine Juan Martin del Potro. World number one Djokovic, 29, suffered a surprise third-round defeat at Wimbledon in July when he lost to American Sam Querrey. The 12-time Grand Slam winner came back to claim his 30th Masters title in Toronto before the Olympics.

More than 20 competitors are due to take part in Saturday's event in Carrbridge in the Cairngorms. Carvers from Scotland, England, Ireland as well as continental Europe, Canada and the US regularly enter the competition. They can use only chainsaws to carve logs into the shapes of animals and people. Last year's winner Pete Bowsher, from Moffat, is to return to defend the title, and retain the first place winner's prize the Claymore Trophy.

Webb suffered a serious foot injury in September. He is close to a return and hopes to be fit before the Six Nations in February. Wales begin their Six Nations campaign away to Ireland in Dublin on Sunday, 7 February. Webb has renewed his national dual contract with Ospreys and the Welsh Rugby Union.

On Tuesday morning, border agents encountered two men carrying backpacks five miles east of Sumas, Washington. Agents interrupted an attempt to smuggle MDMA, or ecstasy, from Canada to San Francisco. One of the men fired a weapon at the agents and ran. The other man, identified as Jeffrey Laviolette, was taken into custody. Nathan Hall was arrested by the Abbotsford Police Department in British Columbia. The backpacks contained a total of 58lb of ecstasy. Kali Henifin and Ryan Lambert were also arrested. The three defendants in US custody face conspiracy as well as drug possession and distribution charges.

Childline counselled more than 4,500 children in the past year compared to about 2,400 in 2011-12. Some children as young as seven told Childline how they were tormented, abused and scared to go to school. Online trolls caused misery and humiliation for thousands of children. The report is being released at the start of Anti-Bullying Week which is coordinated by the Anti Bullying Alliance.

The Jerusalem Planning and Housing Committee postponed a vote on authorising 492 new homes in the settlements of Ramat Shlomo and Ramot, following a request from Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's office. This was done to avoid straining relations with Washington hours before US Secretary of State John Kerry's speech. On Friday, the US chose not to veto a UN Security Council resolution calling for an end to settlement construction. The resolution stated that the establishment of settlements "has no legal validity and constitutes a flagrant violation under international law and a major obstacle to the achievement of the two-state solution and a just, lasting and comprehensive peace".

The Queen's 90th birthday was marked by a series of events, including a visit to Windsor's Royal Mail delivery office. A picture of the Queen, Prince of Wales, Prince William and Prince George was released for stamps to mark the monarch's birthday. The Queen met with staff and viewed an exhibition. The Queen's visit marked the 500th anniversary of the postal service. The Queen will light a beacon setting in train a series of more than 900 beacons across the UK and around the world to mark the milestone birthday.

West Ham United won 3-2. Two quick goals from Sakos goals. The final score was 
0- 3, the game ends. Cheltenham Town 0, West Ham United 2.

Aidan McNicholl, 36, died following a collision on the A5. Andreas Werner, 46, failed to spot the motorcyclist and pleaded guilty to causing death by careless driving. He was fined Â£1,000 and banned from driving in the UK for two years. The victim's family saw no value in Werner being sent to jail. Werner was remorseful.

Imran Khawaja, 27, from Southall, west London, is facing a possible life imprisonment for his role in Syria's battlefields. He left the UK last January and called himself Abu Daigham al-Britani. He was a member of Rayat al Tawheed, a group of fighters affiliated to Islamic State. Khawaja was involved in appeals for donations, video diaries of their lives, and "through the keyhole" tours of fighters' quarters. Khawaja tried to sneak back into the UK, but the police were waiting. He has admitted four offenses. His cousin, Tahir Bhatti, has pleaded guilty to assisting an offender.

Jackson, 22, scored four goals in 36 appearances last season as Wrexham finished eighth in the table. He is Barnsley's third signing for next season. Jackson turned down a contract offer from Wrexham for next season.

Bottles of 'Vanish' have washed up on the Cornish coast. National Trust volunteers have been clearing them away. The National Trust believes a container had gone overboard from a ship. The Maritime and Coastguard Agency said there is no currently available evidence that the bottles washed up on the Cornish coast are from this container. Other nearby coves have also been affected. Cornwall Wildlife Trust is "highly concerned" about the impact on "sensitive marine life". The public are advised to keep children and dogs at a safe distance from the bottles. No attempt should be made to recover the bottles.

The incident occurred on the A9 north of Berriedale in Caithness at about 14:00. Several other people received minor injuries in the crash. The road was closed and diversions were put in place via the A897 Helmsdale to Melvich road. Police Scotland said inquiries into the incident were ongoing.

Dervite, 28, made 14 appearances last season to help Wanderers finish second in League One and secure promotion. The French centre-back joined Bolton from Charlton in 2014 and has made 83 appearances in all competitions. Dervite follows David Wheater, Gary Madine and Jem Karacan in signing new contracts with Bolton, following their promotion to the Championship.

Lib Dem Lord Oates accused Labour of being prepared to "concede everything". The two parties had teamed up to help inflict defeats on the government concerning the rights of EU citizens and parliamentary approval for a Brexit deal. But that co-operation went out the window when MPs rejected those amendments. Baroness Ludford accused Labour of "waving through the government's plans". The Labour source predicted "residual tensions".

In this election, defense is a low priority for most political parties. The UK military is making significant cuts to its armed forces. The size of the UK's regular Army is being reduced from 102,000 to 82,000. The Royal Navy has a fleet of just 19 warships, while the RAF has been left with eight front-line fast jet squadrons. The UK has fallen to sixth place in defense spending, behind the US, China, Russia, Saudi Arabia and France. The UK will likely fall below the Nato threshold. The MoD has the second largest non-protected budget, after welfare, of £34bn a year. The Conservatives, Labour, and the Lib Dems are promising to bring down the budget deficit. The Conservatives plan to make savings of around £12bn a year. The Conservatives are promising to replace the Trident, to increase the defense equipment budget by 1% a year, and to make no further cuts to the size of the regular army. The Conservatives and UKIP are committed to renewing Britain's nuclear deterrent with a like-for-like replacement. Labour will look at whether the Continuous At Sea Deterrent (CASD) can be done with three rather than four submarines. The Liberal Democrats would retain a nuclear deterrent, but end CASD. The SNP and the Greens would scrap it altogether. The UK will have two new operational aircraft carriers. The Royal Navy will struggle to crew both carriers. Plans to equip them with the new F-35 jet, have already had to be scaled down.

Barcelona paid £48.6m for Neymar. Neymar will have cost the club £106.8m. Sandro Rosell resigned as Barcelona president following accusations he misappropriated money. A judge in Spain ruled there was sufficient evidence against Barcelona to continue investigations into the transfer. Barcelona made a complimentary tax declaration of a total of 13,550,830.56 euros. Neymar has scored seven goals in 18 league appearances for Barcelona this season, as well as netting three in seven Champions League matches.

Michael Luciw, 27, was a passenger in a van hit by a car driven the wrong way on the motorway by Albert Kenneth Newman, who also died. Mr. Luciw's family said retired people should undergo regular driving tests. Age UK said it was "vital" older people could drive for as long as possible. Currently drivers over 70 in the UK must fill in a self-assessment form every three years to renew their licences. The Driver and Vehicle Licensing Agency (DVLA) said it had no plans to restrict licensing on the basis of age.

Independent expert Alison Britton will examine the final report on the safety of implants used to treat incontinence. The report concluded procedures should not be offered routinely to women with pelvic organ prolapse and recommended patients be offered a range of treatments and given the information to make "informed choices". Reporting of adverse events should be mandatory. The health secretary said the government did not have the power to ban the procedures. The chairwoman of the independent review apologized for failing to unite all panel members around the review's controversial final report. More than 20,000 women in Scotland have had mesh or tape implants but some have suffered painful and debilitating complications. There are more than 400 women currently taking legal action.

Muir, 23, broke McColgan's 25-year-old record by 14 seconds with a time of 14 minutes, 49.12 seconds. McColgan said she felt excited to see her last record broken by Muir. British Athletics confirmed Muir's time was expected to be classified as official. McColgan said Muir had what it took to win world medals. McColgan said Muir's race had been similar to her own record-breaking race 25 years ago. McColgan said it was a bonus that her record was beaten by a fellow Scot. Muir broke her own British 1500m record at the Diamond League meeting in Paris in August and reached the 1,500m Olympic final at Rio 2016.

Jung won aboard Sam. France's Astier Nicolas took silver and American Phillip Dutton won bronze. GB's William Fox-Pitt finished 12th. Fox-Pitt was competing 10 months after being placed in an induced coma following a fall. He led after the dressage phase, but dropped to 21st after incurring several time penalties in the cross country. Ireland's Jonty Evans finished ninth on Cooley Rorkes Drift.

The Briton, 30, won 6-2 4-6 6-1 7-5 after two hours and 39 minutes. Murray will play Frenchman Benoit Paire in the fourth round on Monday. Fellow Briton Johanna Konta earlier reached the second week for the first time with a 6-4 6-1 win. Fognini, 30, had five set points to force a fifth set but Murray won five games in a row to seal a place in the last 16 for the 11th time.

Paramedics were called to Joe's Bar in Dungiven at 06:00 BST on 6 October 2014. Colleen O'Neill, 43, was charged with two counts of allowing the consumption of liquor outside licensing hours. James Thomas, 44, faced one count of the same charge. Ms. O'Neill was fined £3,000, while Mr. Thomas was fined £1,000. The judge ordered the bar's closure for three months.

Mike Nesbitt said "Domination doesn't work, partnership does." Ulster Unionists want the election to be a referendum on how the Renewable Heat Incentive debacle was handled. Mr. Nesbitt denied that he had any regrets or that he had made a mistake. He said that he "wouldn't withdraw a word" of what he had said. The manifesto, entitled 'Real Partnership', includes calls for action in tackling waiting lists, increasing PSNI numbers to 7,500, prioritising the York Street interchange, standing up for the LGBT community and "guaranteeing" that no group is worse off because of Brexit. In a section entitled 'Cleaning Up Stormont', the party calls for: On the theme of the election being a referendum, he said it was about "incompetence, arrogance, cronyism and the strong whiff of corruption".

Justice Minister Claire Sugden confirmed a motion will go before the assembly for approval. The move will bring Northern Ireland in line with England and Wales, where plans for automatic pardons were announced last month. The law will allow for pardons both posthumously as well as for living gay and bisexual men. Arrangements would be brought in "as soon as possible to ensure that there is equal treatment for gay and bisexual men here as for their counterparts in England and Wales". The motion will now go forward for consideration by the assembly.

The 23-year-old from Kinross finished second behind Kenyan Faith Kipyegon in four minutes, 19.12 seconds. That erased Yvonne Murray's 1994 effort of 4:22.60 in the Scottish rankings and moved her second on the British all-time list behind Zola Budd's 4:17.57. Muir now holds the Scottish 1500m and mile records. Muir hopes to secure an Olympics place for Great Britain in Rio at the British trials in Birmingham from 24 to 26 June. The Scot started her season with an 800m victory in Montbeliard, France, last week and next competes in a week's time in a 1500m race in Stockholm. She recently completed her fourth year of vet school.
Here are some of your pictures from the 26 beaches ranked as Scotland's "most excellent" for water quality.

Dmitry Kovtun and Andrei Lugovoi had no personal motive to kill. The Russian state is likely to have been the sponsor of this plot. UK officials believe the two suspects poisoned Mr. Litvinenko in London in 2006 but they deny any wrongdoing. Mr. Litvinenko drank tea containing a fatal dose of polonium-210. He died in hospital nearly three weeks later. The evidence suggests the only credible explanation is that in one form or another the Russian state was involved in Mr. Litvinenko's murder. The risk to the general public in London from polonium radiation will never be known, and also that Mr. Litvinenko had been poisoned twice in the run-up to his death. Attempts to extradite the two men have failed and they remain in Russia.

Smith, 26, will captain the Twenty20 team in the absence of the injured Aaron Finch. David Warner, 28, has been named as Smith's vice-captain. Smith had already captained the side in three Tests against India last summer. Smith has played in 32 Tests for his country, scoring 2,952 runs at an average of 54.66. Smith and Warner will lead Australia in the limited-overs matches that follow the final Ashes Test at the Oval, which starts on 20 August.

Mr. Farron refused to answer the question of whether he believed homosexual sex was a sin. He said he was "passionate about LGBT-plus rights" and defending equal marriage would be "at the top of my agenda". He also said he wanted to extend the marital rights of transgender people. Mr. Farron voted against the Equality Bill in 2007. He said the Lib Dems tabled an amendment to the Equality Bill because of concerns about "protection of individual liberties" and when that was defeated he voted against the bill.

Sanofi closed its drug manufacturing site in Fawdon in 2015 with the loss of 450 jobs. Accord Healthcare is to use the plant for its pharmaceutical production, with the hope many of the jobs will be filled by ex-Sanofi staff. Accord Healthcare develops, manufactures and distributes more than 130 pharmaceutical products to about 60 countries worldwide.

Richard Ellis is leaving on Friday at the end of his contract. Ciaran Monaghan and Ewan Sutherland are both going under a voluntary redundancy and early retirement scheme. Stephen Flynn said the departures were indicative of the council's inability to hold on to senior staff and expected further departures in the coming months. Mr. Ellis is the council's former interim director of corporate governance and has been acting as deputy chief executive for several months. Mr. Monaghan is head of the chief executive's office, while Mr. Sutherland is head of human resources and customer services. Council chief executive Angela Scott thanked the trio for their "dedication and professionalism".

The English rider crashed at this year's TT and the Fireblade bike has been plagued by mechanical problems. Martin said he was quitting road racing but later clarified his position on Facebook. He has no plans to do anymore road racing on the Hondas this year. He didn't race at the North West 200 and will not compete in next month's Ulster Grand Prix. The TT was a disaster. He wants to race classics and oddball stuff.

The All Progressives Congress (APC) won 19 of the 28 governor posts. The Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) lost the presidential poll last month for the first time. APC leader Muhammadu Buhari will be inaugurated on 29 May. The PDP won eight governorships. The election in Imo state was declared inconclusive. Elections were not held in seven states. The APC has made historic gains, relegating the once-powerful PDP to a regional party. The Independent National Electoral Commission (Inec) reported 66 violent incidents at polling stations.

Mighty, a US-based environmental lobby group, made claims against Olam and its main stakeholder, Singapore state-owned investment company Temasek. Mighty accuses Olam and Temasek of turning a blind eye to unsustainable palm oil trading practices that may contribute to haze. Olam buys 99% of its palm oil from third party suppliers. Olam's chief executive said the firm had a "very vigorous sourcing policy and we insist that there is zero tolerance for burning, so it's a 'no burn-no peat-no deforestation' compliance policy". Temasek has dismissed the allegations. The report also highlights concerns in Gabon, where according to Mighty, Olam "bulldozes rainforests to establish monoculture palm oil plantations." Olam said its private-public partnerships in Gabon strove to be both responsible and transparent.
A restaurant began serving puppy platters after a new law was introduced allowing dogs to eat at restaurants outdoors.
Fernando Forestieri (knee) is a doubt. David Nugent (groin) could return. Jacob Butterfield is hoping for a recall.

Pakistan's telecoms regulator said the ban on YouTube was no longer necessary because Google launched a Pakistan-specific version. The Pakistan Telecommunication Authority (PTA) official confirmed that all internet service providers had been directed to open access to YouTube. Google has provided an online web process through which requests for blocking access of offending material can be made by the PTA to Google directly. A YouTube spokeswoman said government requests for the removal of content would not automatically be granted. Pakistan's ban on YouTube was imposed by the Supreme Court in 2012 after the US-made film Innocence of Muslims was uploaded. Google revealed last week that it had launched local versions of YouTube for Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka.

Domenico Scala heads up Fifa's Ad-Hoc Electoral Committee. Gianni Infantino, one of the five presidential candidates, is Swiss-Italian, as is Scala. LFA boss Musa Bility says he will go to the Court of Arbitration for Sport if Scala does not withdraw by Thursday. The battle to replace Blatter takes place in 18 days' time. The election will take place in Zurich.

Daniel Timbers, 29, and Barry Joy, 56, were killed at Harford Attachments in Spar Road shortly after 09:00 BST on Monday. The men were believed to have been working in a paint-spraying area. Their bodies were removed from the site on Tuesday afternoon. A forensic search has been carried out at the company, which makes buckets for diggers. Evidence suggests there has been a flashover explosion, which occurs when you have a build-up of toxic fumes. The Health and Safety Executive said its inspectors and electrical safety experts would be gathering evidence.

Tunisia had faced expulsion from the 2017 Africa Cup of Nations until apologising to Caf for complaints it lodged against the organization. Morocco was only able to enter the 2017 Nations Cup qualifying draw after the Court of Arbitration for Sport (Cas) overturned a ban on its participation. Tunisia will face Togo, Liberia and Djibouti in Group A while Morocco will Cape Verde, Libya and Sao Tome in Group F.

Chelsea won 3-1 at Etihad Stadium. Sergio Aguero and Fernandinho were sent off, but Cesc Fabregas will not face any further action. Aguero received a four-match ban and Fernandinho will serve a three-match ban. Both clubs have until 18:00 GMT on 8 December to respond to the charge.
