About 80,000 works of art faced being auctioned to help pay off the pottery firm's pension debt. A public fundraising campaign hit its target in a month. The collection will remain on display at the museum in Barlaston, Staffordshire. The Art Fund will gift the collection to the Victoria and Albert Museum, before it is loaned to the Wedgwood Museum. The Wedgwood Museum inherited Waterford Wedgwood plc's pension bill after the firm collapsed in 2009. In 2011 a high court judge ruled its collection could be sold to reimburse the Pension Protection Fund.

Wright may buy 20% of the club and become a club director. Billericay are eighth in the Isthmian League Premier Division, three points adrift of a play-off place. Wright played non-league football for a succession of clubs. Billericay have recently been taken over by multi-millionaire Glenn Tamplin. The club signed former England international Paul Konchesky.
Blackpool and Colchester United tied 1-1. Jamille Matt scored for Blackpool, and Kurtis Guthrie scored for Colchester United. Sean Murray of Colchester United received a red card.

The disused Fawley power station chimney would be the tallest such attraction south of London's Shard. The power station closed in 2013 after more than 40 years in operation. Architects plans show a petal-shaped glass structure at the centre of a Â£1bn development featuring a marina, housing and restaurants. It also includes fast ferry links to Southampton and Portsmouth. Building could start in 2018. The oil-fired Fawley Power Station was commissioned in 1971 and was capable of powering one million homes. The 300-acre site was sold to Fawley Waterside developers in 2016. The 198 metre-high chimney dominates the Solent skyline. One million homes were powered by Fawley.

At the Hong Kong championships, a 23-year-old earned GB's second medal, taking bronze. In the men's team pursuit, GB was beaten to the bronze medal by Italy. In the women's team pursuit, GB finished fifth in the heats and failed to make the bronze-medal ride. Olympic bronze medalist Katy Marchant was eliminated from the women's sprint in the first round.

Kemp, who last played Grant Mitchell in 2006, will return for Barbara's final episodes. Dame Barbara announced her character would be killed off. Her character reappeared on Friday, having left in 2010, to tell her eldest son Phil that her cancer had returned. Producers revealed that Peggy would die from the disease in emotional scenes to be screened in the spring. Kemp played Grant from 1990-1999 and then again in 2005 and 2006. Grant Mitchell has been one of the soap's most memorable characters in its 30-year history, arriving in 1990 along with brother Phil.

Sadio Mane scored twice in 138 seconds. Spurs have won just twice on the road since September 24th. In their past 17 meetings with the other top-six sides away from home, Pochettino's team have won just once.

The All Progressives Congress (APC) won 19 of the 28 governor posts. The Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) lost the presidential poll last month for the first time. APC leader Muhammadu Buhari will be inaugurated on 29 May. The PDP won eight governorships. The election in Imo state was declared inconclusive. Elections were not held in seven states. The APC has made historic gains, relegating the once-powerful PDP to a regional party. The Independent National Electoral Commission (Inec) reported 66 violent incidents at polling stations. On Sunday, Inec also announced that the APC had retained power in Lagos state.

Visitors to the Hebridean Celtic Festival can use an app to trigger online information. The festival is taking place in Stornoway on the Isle of Lewis from 19 to 22 July. The Waterboys, Imelda May, Lucy Spraggan, Skerryvore, Peatbog Faeries and Dougie MacLean are among this year's acts.

Park View and Nansen Primary schools will have their funding agreements terminated. Park View Educational Trust may be removed from running the schools. Oldknow Academy and Golden Hill schools were warned they could lose funding unless concerns were addressed. A head teacher said parents tried to undermine her authority. The watchdog published 
21 reports into schools allegedly targeted as part of a hardline Muslim takeover. Five of those schools, including Park View and Oldknow, were rated inadequate.

Vincent Barker died in July 2012, five months after an eye test at Boots in Ipswich. Honey Rose, 35, denies a charge of gross negligence manslaughter. The prosecution said Rose's failure to detect Vinnie's swollen optic discs was "at the heart of the prosecution case". A build-up of fluid in his brain led to his death. The prosecution alleges Vinnie's death was preventable. The trial continues.

Clive Weatherhogg set up meetings between a woman and a man and filmed them having sex. He sent a sexually explicit clip to the victim's sister on Christmas Day. Weatherhogg, 42, was placed on the sex offenders register. He was found guilty of coercing the woman to engage in sexual activity and intercourse with the man. He was also convicted of intentionally causing the woman's sister and father to look at sexual images and behaving in a threatening or abusive manner. Weatherhogg was assessed as posing "a moderate risk" of sexual re-offending.

Ireland made 165-5, but Afghanistan made 171-4 with two overs to spare. Stuart Thompson hit 56, while Gary Wilson (41 no) and captain William Porterfield (39) added valuable runs for Ireland. Samiullah Shenwari (56) and Mohammad Shahzad (47) helped the Afghans. The sides meet again in the second T20 on Friday. Paul Stirling was dismissed for a duck. Afghan spinner Amir Hamza (2-23) was the only bowler to take more than one wicket. Boyd Rankin was lost for the T20s, but is expected to return for the five ODIs against Afghanistan, starting on 15 March.

Barcelona paid £48.6m for Neymar. Neymar will have cost the club £106.8m. Sandro Rosell resigned as Barcelona president following accusations he misappropriated money. A judge in Spain ruled there was sufficient evidence against Barcelona to continue investigations into the transfer. Barcelona made a complimentary tax declaration of a total of 13,550,830.56 euros. Neymar has scored seven goals in 18 league appearances for Barcelona this season, as well as netting three in seven Champions League matches.

The bodies of David Miller, 24, and Hannah Witheridge, 23, were discovered on a beach in Koh Tao on 15 September. Two Burmese suspects are being held by Thai police. UK detectives will compile a report and update the families of Hannah and David. Zaw Lin and Win Zaw Htun, both aged 21, are alleged to have confessed to the killings. The two suspects are charged with conspiracy to murder, conspiracy to rape and robbery, and could face the death penalty if found guilty. The UK Foreign Office summoned the Thai charge d'affaires to express concerns about the police investigation. Post-mortem examinations found Mr. Miller died from drowning and a blow to the head, while Miss Witheridge died from head wounds. DNA found on Ms. Witheridge matched samples taken from the suspects.

The Scots have won all five qualifiers and host Iceland at Falkirk Stadium on Friday. Iceland is also unbeaten after four wins from four. The outcome of Friday's contest and the return fixture in Reykjavik on 20 September likely to decide who tops the group. Scotland is in pole position to reach next summer's finals in the Netherlands without the need for a play-off. Evans is one of 12 players in the current 20-strong squad who play outside Scotland. Evans recently celebrated winning the women's Bundesliga in her first season at Bayern.

Apple has implemented a security measure to stop third-party software from infiltrating its internet storage service, iCloud. The process introduces an extra step after an account holder has typed their username and password into a new device. They are required to enter a four-digit code that is texted to a trusted mobile phone number or sent via Apple's Find My iPhone app. If the code is not entered, access to iCloud is refused. A 14-character recovery key can be used to regain access to the account if the trusted device is lost or stolen. Apple plans to encourage people to turn on two-factor authentication and use stronger passwords.

UKIP spent £2,956,737, the Tories spent £2,980,815, the Lib Dems spent £1,580,575, and Labour spent £1,027,339. The figures cover the campaign period from 23 January to polling day, 22 May. UKIP's campaign spending was 68p for each of their 4,376,635 votes. Labour spent 26p per vote, the Conservatives 79p and the Lib Dems £1.45. The Green Party spent £534,249 on its campaign - 43p for each of its 1,255,573 votes. The six highest-spending parties spent a total of £9,347,087 on campaigning. All but Labour spent more than they did during the 2009 European election campaign.

Anderson, 27, has cancelled his Barrow contract to join their National League rivals. Keating, 21, was recommended to Gulls boss Kevin Nicholson by ex-Port Vale manager Micky Adams. The Gulls are currently four points above the relegation zone, and have won only one of their last six games.

A 10-year-old Irish-bred horse collapsed and died after winning the Cotswold Chase. The British Horseracing Authority confirmed the horse suffered from a "severe pulmonary haemorrhage". Episodes such as this are rare and can occur in horses which have no underlying health issues. Many Clouds had shown symptoms of post-race ataxia in the past, but had never collapsed before.

Tricia Marwick was visibly emotional after Duncan McNeil and Alex Salmond bid farewell to the parliament. Marwick, Salmond, and McNeil are among those standing down as MSPs ahead of the election on 5 May. Salmond served as first minister between 2007 and 2014. McNeil is stepping down as an MSP after serving in the parliament since it was established in 1999. Former Scottish Conservative MSP Annabel Goldie is also bowing out of Holyrood.

Emma Watson will play Belle, Dan Stevens will play the Beast, and Luke Evans will co-star as Gaston. Josh Gad will play Gaston's sidekick LeFou. Kevin Kline will play Maurice, the father of Belle. The star will play Mrs. Potts. Bill Condon will direct the movie, which begins filming in May at Shepperton Studios. The film will be released in US cinemas on 17 March 2017.

The Crown Prosecution Service (CPS) will reveal its intentions at a meeting with victims' relatives at 11:00 BST. Ninety-six football fans were fatally injured in the 1989 stadium disaster. Last year, new inquests into the disaster in Sheffield concluded the fans had been unlawfully killed. Files of evidence relating to 23 suspects were referred to the CPS to decide whether charges should be brought. Relatives have been invited to a private meeting in Warrington, where they will be informed of the decisions by Sue Hemming, head of the special crime and counter-terrorism division at the CPS.

Chelmsford Prison told residents there had been "numerous incidents" of packages being hurled over the wall. A former inmate said the jail was "notorious" for being "flooded" with mobile phones and synthetic cannabis. The Ministry of Justice said staff worked "extremely hard" to stop contraband from getting into prisons. A woman who lives near the prison said she had witnessed packages being thrown over the wall "four times in two weeks." The former inmate claimed drones were used to fly contraband goods "straight up to prison windows", but the Ministry of Justice said there was no evidence of drones coming into the Chelmsford site. Laws had been introduced which mean people who smuggle packages over prison walls could be jailed for up to two years.

Sylvia Blackburn, 72, suffered serious head injuries outside Bedford Road Lower School last December. Brian Wright, 55, told Luton Crown Court he had been blinded by the setting sun. He accepted he had struck Mrs. Blackburn but denies causing serious injury by dangerous driving. Mrs. Blackburn is now being treated in residential care. Mr. Wright's VW Golf failed to stop for a red light. Mrs. Blackburn had been on duty in Bedford Road as pupils left school. The court heard the sun was 10 minutes from setting and could have been shining into Mr. Wright's eyes. The trial continues.

Muir will not be with the Scotland team at next year's event on Australia's Gold Coast because of her veterinary medicine studies. The 24-year-old finished fourth and sixth in the 1500m and 5,000m at the World Athletics Championships. The World Indoor Championships in March are "potentially a target". Muir's time of 14 minutes 52.07 seconds was her new outdoor personal best.

Trevor Deely, 22, was last seen walking home from a Christmas party in December 2000. A search of a site in Chapelizod in Dublin started early on Saturday morning. The search will involve excavations and is expected to take a number of weeks. Earlier this year a team of six detectives began conducting a complete review of Mr. Deely's disappearance. CCTV footage shows Mr. Deely talking to a man dressed in black outside the Bank of Ireland on Baggot Street. Detectives released the footage in April and appealed for the man to come forward. The man seen in the CCTV has not yet been identified.

Del Potro defeated the Swiss player 3-6 6-3 7-6 (7-2) 6-3. Del Potro is 165th in the rankings after missing more than two years because of injury problems. Del Potro will next play either France's 32nd seed Lucas Pouille or American Donald Young. Del Potro, 27, reached the Wimbledon semi-finals in 2013 and is playing in his first Grand Slam since the Australian Open in 2014 after having three wrist operations. Kyrgios beat Brown 6-7 (3-7) 6-1 2-6 6-4 6-4. Lopez defeated Fognini 3-6 6-7 6-3 6-3 6-3. Berdych beat Becker 6-4 6-1 6-2, while Tsonga triumphed 6-1 6-4 6-3 over Monaco.

Tunisia had faced expulsion from the 2017 Africa Cup of Nations until apologizing to Caf for complaints it lodged against the organization. Morocco was only able to enter the 2017 Nations Cup qualifying draw after the Court of Arbitration for Sport (Cas) overturned a ban on its participation. Tunisia will face Togo, Liberia, and Djibouti in Group A, while Morocco will face Cape Verde, Libya, and Sao Tome in Group F.

The team has won 182 grands prix, at a win rate of 23.18%, 12 drivers' world championships, and eight constructors' titles. The slump started in 2013, when McLaren lost its way on chassis design, but still had the best engine. The team's last constructors' title was in 1998.

Paramedics were called to Joe's Bar in Dungiven at 06:00 BST on 6 October 2014. Till receipts showed alcohol was being served as late as 04:49 BST. The judge ordered its closure for three months. Colleen O'Neill, 43, was charged with two counts of allowing the consumption of liquor outside licensing hours. James Thomas, 44, faced one count of the same charge. Ms. O'Neill was fined £3,000, while Mr. Thomas was fined £1,000.

Stephen Curry scored 45 points to rally the Golden State Warriors to a 116-105 victory over the Portland Trail Blazers. Curry broke his own NBA record for most 3-pointers in a season. LaMarcus Aldridge had 27 points and six rebounds, and Damian Lillard added 20 points and eight assists for the Blazers. Pau Gasol had 16 points and 15 rebounds as the Chicago Bulls beat the Miami Heat 89-78. Dwyane Wade scored nine points, shooting just 4 for 20.

Mario Balotelli, Fabio Borini, Rickie Lambert, and Lazar Markovic met Bas van Velzen at Melwood. Van Velzen showcased his free-kick skills. Van Velzen has become a youtube sensation by uploading videos of his free-kick exploits.

Women who carry the BRCA1 gene can reduce their risk of death from breast cancer by having their ovaries removed. A study found that having an oophorectomy was associated with a 62% drop in breast cancer death in women with a BRCA1 mutation. For BRCA1 carriers who had their ovaries removed within two years, there was a 73% reduction in death. Genetic tests are available to women who are likely to have a BRCA1 or BRCA2 mutation.

A married couple, Derek Lowe (38) and Tina Lowe (33), were struck and killed by an Amtrak train shortly before 10 am on Easter Sunday in Durham, North Carolina. The train, No. 80, was heading from Charlotte to New York City. None of the 166 passengers on the train were injured, but a man who fell ill during the delay received treatment. The train was delayed for about two hours and 45 minutes before continuing on its route.

Carlos Toro, 66, worked for the DEA for 27 years as an undercover operative in exchange for US citizenship. He is now facing deportation after retiring. Toro was a mid-level member of the Medellin cartel in the 1980s. He provided information about his former bosses and associates. The DEA refused to help Toro with his citizenship. He is now technically living in the US illegally.

The US body that regulates internet addresses is looking to crack down on a Canadian company using the new '.sucks' domain name to extract exorbitant sums from celebrities and companies. Kevin Spacey is reportedly among celebrities paying to have their name removed from one of the '.sucks' domains. The owners recommended to resell '.sucks' domains for around $2,499 a year.

A mother of a baby boy was arrested 27 years after his body was found wrapped in a blanket inside a Sainsbury's bag floating on a village pond. The boy's body was exhumed from his grave in Norfolk last year after the case came up for periodical review. A DNA sample eventually led them to his mother. The woman was arrested on suspicion of infanticide, but the charge was dropped after she explained how the baby had been stillborn. The baby's body was exhumed by officers as part of a case review, with DNA samples leading police to the boy's mother. The boy has now been reburied at Weasenham St Peter church, Norfolk. Police said they have ruled out any foul play and the woman remains on bail while the CPS decide whether to charge her with failing to register a birth and preventing a lawful burial.

A taxi driver was ordered to pay compensation to a passenger who was left with severe brain injuries after he jumped out of the moving car. Kristopher Hicks, now 27, was on his way home from a night out in Bath, Somerset, with his girlfriend in a taxi driven by Michael Young, 56, five years ago. Mr. Young mistakenly believed Mr. Hicks was planning to not pay and decided to drive him back to the rank. Mr. Hicks jumped from the vehicle while it was traveling at more than 20mph. He suffered devastating brain injuries and now requires round-the-clock care from his mother. Mr. Hicks' family took driver Mr. Young to the high court where a judge ruled he had unlawfully imprisoned his passenger. The exact amount of compensation is yet to be decided but is set to be around 50 percent of what the family had requested.

Tornado sirens blared Wednesday night in Kansas as several storms brought reports of twisters. Spotters reported a tornado about 6 miles northwest of Goddard. Other reports of tornadoes came in from southwestern Kansas. The National Weather Service indicated a tornado may have touched down in Potosi, Missouri. On Thursday, more storms are expected in the midwest, Mississippi River Valley, Tennessee River Valley and near the southern great lakes.

Luke Rockhold is ready to fight Lyoto Machida in New Jersey. Rockhold is bidding for his fourth consecutive victory since losing to Vitor Belfort two years ago and has a title shot in his sights. Machida is also coming off the back of a victory, against CB Dollaway in Brazil. Machida is confident he can upset Rockhold and earn himself a title shot.

An aeroplane touched down on a runway without deploying its landing gear and skidded along the runway on its belly. The incident was captured in Fort Pierce, Florida. The pilot re-engaged the engines and took off back into the air. The plane flew 100 miles to Fort Lauderdale and landed safely. The FAA is investigating the incident.

Manuel Pellegrini admitted he is disappointed in Yaya Toure but will back him until the end of the season. Sportsmail revealed that Manchester City would listen to offers for Toure. Toure has come in for criticism for his performances this season. Sam Allardyce has warned Aaron Cresswell not to make the same mistake as others amid interest from Chelsea and Manchester City.

Domenico Rancadore, a Sicilian mafia fugitive, will be allowed to remain in the UK after his sentence was dropped. He was given a seven-year sentence in 1999 by an Italian court for being a member of the Cosa Nostra. His case expired last October, and his European arrest warrant is to be withdrawn. Italian law states that a sentence is extinguished once a period of more than double the time of the penalty has passed.

Mr Mole, ridden by AP McCoy, is one of three 7-2 co-favourites in the seven-runner line-up for the grade one celebration chase at Sandown on Saturday. Paul Nicholls-trained Mr Mole is bracketed with Irish raider Special Tiara and Nicky Henderson's Sprinter Sacre. AP McCoy and Mr Mole will have six rivals in the grade one celebration chase at Sandown on Saturday. Mr Mole will be McCoy's last ride in a grade one race. Other runners in the celebration chase include Mick Channon's Somersby.

The mother of Marcia, who was murdered 40 years ago, recently saw crime scene photos of her daughter's body. Marcia was raped and choked to death by Jerome Sydney Barrett in 1975. Marcia's body was found 33 days after she disappeared. Barrett was found guilty of second-degree murder six years ago and sentenced to 44 years.

New figures show that 272 youngsters left disabled by foetal alcohol syndrome were hospitalised in England over the past 12 months. Research suggests that at least one in 100 babies born in the UK could suffer learning and behavioural problems because of exposure to alcohol in the womb. Other medical issues associated with alcohol consumption during pregnancy include problems with the liver, kidneys and heart, cerebral palsy, sight loss and epilepsy. Pregnant women are advised by the government not to drink alcohol.

Shaun Andrew McKerry attempted to rob a store with an axe, but the shopkeeper tackled him, and the shopkeeper's wife hit him with a baseball bat. McKerry was arrested and jailed for six years. He was previously known as "boomerang boy" and had a history of crime.

Four Royal Navy sailors have been charged with gang rape. The four men are required to stay in Nova Scotia until they have been tried. Bail was set at over £2,000 for each of them. The accused men are Joshua Finbow, Craig Stoner, Simon Radford, and Darren Smalley. The four men are charged with sexual assault causing bodily harm and group sexual assault. The alleged sexual assault took place on April 0. The accused men are required to surrender their passports and live at the nearby stadacona naval base in Halifax.

A mother was reported to the police for child abuse after a stranger mistook her son's rare skin disease for signs of abuse. Her son, RJ Jackson, has Netherton's syndrome, a rare congenital skin disease that makes his skin appear red and scaly. The mother regularly covers him in creams to prevent his skin from drying out. She has also been subjected to taunts in the street.

The controversial posters are being taken down because the three-week advertising period has ended. The advertising standards authority has received over 200 complaints about the adverts. The company also said it had taken note of the reaction from customers to the advert and that they would bear it in mind if they received a request to put up posters of a similar nature in future.

Rail firms are planning fare hikes of up to 87% despite pledges to freeze prices. The Prime Minister has requested First Great Western to review its decision to almost double some fares on the route between London and the Cotswolds. Passengers traveling with the rail firm between London and the Cotswolds could face increases of up to 87% come May 17. Virgin has said the "vast majority" of its price hikes affected "virgin trains-only fares".

Former soldier John Young, 66, was blinded in one eye after thugs threw a brick at him. He was hit in the face with a brick after confronting them about throwing stones at his property. The attack occurred three weeks after the couple got married. The couple were writing thank you cards for wedding gifts when their home was targeted. Police have launched an investigation into the attack.

Derbyshire wicketkeeper Tom Poynton has signed a new one-year contract extension. Poynton missed the 2014 campaign due to leg injuries from a road accident. He made his playing comeback during Derbyshire's pre-season tour of Abu Dhabi. He will be available for the start of the season and has committed himself to the county until the end of the 2016 season.

A five-year-old boy, Harley, was diagnosed with cancer in his kidney, neck, lungs and bones. He was diagnosed with neuroblastoma, a rare and aggressive childhood cancer. He was given the all clear by doctors. He was diagnosed with cancer in his kidney, lung, bones and neck after mother stacey took him to a doctor with a stomach pain. He was diagnosed with neuroblastoma - a rare and aggressive childhood cancer which affects fewer than 100 children in the UK.

Tim Sherwood wants Jack Grealish to focus on his Aston Villa career. Grealish is at the center of a tug of war between the Republic of Ireland and England. Grealish's dad agreed that his son must concentrate on his club football first.

Landing fees for private jet companies can vary dramatically. The high landing fees give an insight into some of the most unexpectedly popular transport hubs for the rich and famous. The busiest weekends for private jets are during huge sporting events. The busiest weekends are during the super bowl and the Monaco Grand Prix. The most expensive airport for landing fees is Haneda airport.

Katie Gallegos took her dog Cooper to a McDonald's drive-thru for ice cream. Cooper ate the ice cream very quickly. The video of Cooper's ice cream outing has been watched more than seven million times. Another video shows the dogs visiting a Starbucks for a "pup-uccino".

Gary Locke has been given the role at Kilmarnock on a permanent basis after signing a three-year deal. The former Hearts boss joined the club as assistant boss to Allan Johnston last summer but took control of the team when his ex-tynecastle team-mate quit at the start of February. The 41-year-old has lost just once in seven games since taking over at rugby park.

A Florida mother has accused a school of threatening to suspend her five-year-old autistic son because of essential oils he wears to help combat his illness. Teachers at Seminole County Elementary warned they would remove kindergartner Logan from class because the products, manufactured by doterra, smell and are a distraction to youngsters around him. The 32-year-old puts the oil on his neck as she believes it keeps him calm and focused. The family uses oils with scents such as lavender, chamomile and sandalwood. Lake county school district told the station they would not suspend Logan, saying it was a ` health issue '.

A fire spread through 90 condos in a beach-side apartment complex in Westhampton Beach on Wednesday at 3 pm, causing the building to collapse. The fire was so intense it melted the paint off nearby buildings. Twelve fire crews tried to control the flames but could not get inside any of the summer homes. The Sandpiper complex is open between May and November. The cause of the fire is unknown, but there are claims it started near a car parked by the complex.

The Queen was spotted riding through Windsor Great Park on her fell pony. The Queen, who has never worn riding helmets, has been encouraged to wear safety hats. The Queen has been riding since the age of four. The Queen's first pony was a shetland pony named Peggy. The Queen has cut down on the amount of time she spends in the saddle due to a knee injury. The Queen breeds fell ponies and has a stud specializing in highland pony.

A 55-year-old man was allegedly killed by a single punch from a 28-year-old shift worker during a row in front of their homes. The 28-year-old was granted conditional bail. The case is due to return to court on May 18.

Jose Mourinho talks to God every day, but never about football. He has worked with the word food programme as an ambassador against hunger. He tries to separate his professional and family life. He only prays for things in his personal life, never about football. He is a 52-year-old father-of-two. He only goes to church regularly in Portugal.

Bob Barker, who hosted "The Price is Right" for 35 years before stepping down in 2007, returned to the show on the April 1 edition. Barker, at 91, handled the first price-guessing game before turning hosting duties over to Drew Carey.

An off-duty secret service agent, Arthur Baldwin, was arrested in Washington D.C. at 12:30 am on Friday for attempted burglary and destruction of property. Baldwin was arrested on the 3200 block of D Street SE. The agency revoked Baldwin's security clearance and put him on leave. Baldwin is posted to the foreign missions branch. Court records show Baldwin was to be arraigned Friday afternoon. Baldwin's arrest comes two days after a high-ranking supervisor was also put on leave after he was accused of misconduct. The homeland security department's inspector general is investigating the allegations of misconduct by the supervisor. The inspector general is already investigating a March 4 incident in which two high-ranking agency officials are accused of driving into a secure area at the white house after a night of drinking.

Atif Saeed, a 38-year-old freelance photographer from Lahore, Pakistan, was in the city's safari park when he spotted a male lion. He got out of his car and crept up to the lion armed with only a camera. He got within 10 feet of the lion and took a couple of frames before the lion noticed him. The lion jumped towards him, and he scrambled into his car.

A woman, believed to be between 25 and 45 years old, was found unconscious on March 22 in Brooklyn and pronounced dead that evening. She had a tattoo on her right leg of a heart with the name "Monique". The NYPD has released images of the tattoo in hopes of identifying her.

A New Zealand couple built a solar-powered, two-bedroom home on a flatbed truck after returning from the UK because they could not afford property. The project took a year and a half and cost about $25,000. The home is located in Nelson, New Zealand, and is nearly self-sufficient.

Researchers claim that children who share iPads in class do much better in early literacy tests than those who do not. Courtney Blackwell found that kindergarten children who shared iPads in classes over an academic year significantly outscored their peers who were in classes that had no iPads or in which each student had their own device. Shared iPad students scored around 30 points higher than students who used the device on their own and non-iPad users.

A piglet was born with its back legs missing and has learned to walk on its front trotters. A video shows the young animal taking unsteady steps, wobbling about with its snout to the ground, foraging for food. The piglet belongs to farmer, Ms. Duan, from Qionglai city in Sichuan province, south western China.

On Sunday, during the IndyCar Grand Prix of Louisiana, a pit crew member, Todd Phillips, a front-outside tire changer for Dayle Coyne Racing, was injured when he was struck by the car of Francesco Dracone, who had come in on lap 25 for tires and fuel. Dracone spun while exiting his pit box, clipping Phillips' leg. Phillips was taken to the infield care center for treatment where he received stitches for a cut on his leg and has been released. Dracone did not finish the race and wound up 23rd.

Milton Vieira Severiano smashed his dancer wife's head into concrete paving 11 times and then shot her in the face five times. He confessed that he carried out the act because he was jealous of men looking at her. Severiano was picked up by police after crashing a stolen car. Police found four handguns, a shotgun, and a bulletproof vest in his car.

Sarah Wilson, author of "I Quit Sugar", revealed she almost took her own life due to anxiety. She felt her life was not worth living because of stress, anxiety, thyroid disease, and a distant family. She felt isolated and alone. Wilson believes depression and anxiety are linked. One in three Australian women will experience anxiety in their lifetime.

Elena Curtin of Portland, Oregon, who was seven-months pregnant, was charged with second-degree assault after she struck her boyfriend's ex in the head and arm with a crowbar in November 2014. Prosecutors dropped the charge because Curtin was "completely justified in her outrage". When Curtin came home, she found her boyfriend's ex-girlfriend shooting heroin in her bathroom. Oregon law allows for use of physical force against an intruder who won't leave a resident's home.

Gemma the pit bull was filmed at home in California being fed some treats. Her owner throws a broccoli spear into the mix. Immediately the canine pulls a look of disgust as she chomps on the vegetable and then proceeds to spit it out on the floor.

HSBC apologized after a link on its official website directed visitors to a pornographic page. The porn site took over the address after the awards were scrapped in 2011 and the organizers allowed its registration to retire. HSBC removed the hyperlink from its main website and denied any associations with the external site. HSBC apologized to the public for any inconvenience caused.

A 13-year-old boy called 911 after a fire broke out in his home in Clinton on Sunday. Marcus and his 9-year-old sister were trapped in a second-floor bedroom. Marcus stayed calm throughout the 11-minute call and provided firefighters with directions. The siblings were rescued and taken to the children's hospital with non-life-threatening injuries. The other three family members escaped on their own and were taken to Medstar hospital.

Amazing pictures have emerged of blue fluorescent algae lighting up Australia's east coast. The images were taken in Jervis Bay, the south coast of NSW. Photographer Andy Hutchinson described the sight as a 'beautiful supernatural scene' caused by millions of plankton omitting light. A similar display was shown in Sydney's Manly Beach back in August 2014. Iain Suthers, of the University of New South Wales, says the algae blossoms in the spring and the autumn.

New tests pinpoint genetic markers in tumors to determine aggressiveness, potentially sparing breast cancer patients chemotherapy. After surgery, cancer cells are screened, and women are informed within days about their risk of recurrence. For some, the risk can be as low as 5%, comparable to chemotherapy. The tests, like Endopredict, cost about £2,500 and may soon be available on the NHS.

More than 25 women have been airlifted from Royal Navy ships because of pregnancy. One ship, HMS Ocean, had five pregnant sailors removed in emergency evacuations during the last nine years. At least one woman was airlifted from HMS Illustrious. Eighteen other ships had emergency evacuations. A strict "no touching" rule is in place at sea. Ninety-nine servicewomen on operations were flown back to the UK between January 2006 and December 2013. A further 102 women were evacuated from Iraq. Strict military rules ban mothers-to-be from serving in war zones.

A drone carrying traces of a radioactive material was found on the rooftop of Japan's equivalent to the White House. The drone was equipped with a small camera, smoke flares and a plastic bottle containing small traces of a radioactive material believed to be cesium. The discovery is raising concerns about terrorism. Japanese law restricts drone flights around airports, but there are no flight restrictions for most of Tokyo, including the prime minister's residence and local and federal government buildings.

A security guard from China takes his 84-year-old mother, who suffers from Alzheimer's, with him to work on his motorbike every day. He ties a sash around both of their waists to make sure she does not fall off. His mother has her own room at his workplace, a bank.

A major study of alcohol use concludes that more Americans are drinking heavily and engaging in episodes of binge- drinking. Heavy drinking among Americans rose 17.2 percent between 2005 and 2012. In 2012, 8 percent of Americans were considered heavy drinkers and 18 percent were binge drinkers.

Doctors are putting the health of women and their babies at risk by performing caesarean sections too readily, un officials warn. The procedure should only be carried out when ` medically necessary ' because it can lead to infections and even death. Just over a quarter of women giving birth in england now have a caesarean and the rate has more than doubled since the early 1990s. Experts from the world health organisation, the un 's public health agency, said this figure should ideally be between just 10 per cent and 15 per cent, due to the dangers and costs involved. The procedure can lead to ` significant complications, disability or death ' and diverts precious money away from the needs of other patients. A planned caesarean costs the nhs an average of £ 2,369, compared to a natural birth at £ 1,665. The who said that doctors were carrying them out too often, and underestimating the risks. Previous research has found that as many as one in ten caesareans cause infections.

Michelle Filkins, 44, of West Wareham, was arrested on April 17 and charged with breaking and entering, larceny over $250, and malicious destruction of property. She allegedly broke into a home on Martha's Vineyard, lived there for at least a week, and sold items belonging to the owners in a yard sale. The owner, Mark Conklin, found her in his home on April 17. Items missing include four deck chairs from crate & barrel, a weber grill, two side tables from ethan allen, one ann chase lamp, two lamps from crate & barrel, two framed posters, various pots, pans, and linens, and a painting by the owner. Filkins is next scheduled to be in court on May 14. Police are asking anyone who received items from the home to return them.

Police posted photos on a woman's Facebook page to track her down after her lost iPhone was handed in to the Albury police station on Sunday morning. The phone belonged to Bella Crooke, who lost it at a friend's birthday party. Police officers posted selfies and photos of the phone on her Facebook page. Bella reclaimed her phone and said she didn't even have to give her name because officers recognized her from her Facebook page.

A five-day-old baby hippopotamus was caught in a fight between two adult hippos and was thrown into the air. The calf's mother watched in horror as the hippo was flung into the air before being dragged along the surface of the water in the isimangaliso wetland park, in eastern south africa. The calf died hours later.

A three-bedroom apartment in Knightsbridge is on sale for £575,000. The apartment has a three-year lease. The cost would work out at £191,000 per year, or £15,000 per month. If any buyer decides to extend the lease, the property could be worth upwards of £6 million. The property is described as `bright and well proportioned' with 1,990 sq/ft of space. The property has three bedrooms, two bathrooms, a reception room and utility room along with a lift, parking and a communal garden.

A computer outage affected registers at 8,000 stores in the US and Canada. The outage began in the early evening on the east coast and in the late afternoon on the west coast. The outage affected 
7,000 stores in the US and 1,000 in Canada. The outage was caused by a failure during a daily system refresh. The outage affected stores in the US and Canada. The outage affected stores in the US and Canada.

Terrorists are undergoing training in rural areas of west Wales. Locations in Ceredigion, Powys, and Pembrokeshire are being used to radicalize Muslims. Incidents of Islamic extremist activity in Wales can be traced back to 1998.

An Omura's whale, feared to be extinct, was found on a remote Exmouth beach in WA. It is the first sighting of the species in WA and only the second in Australia. The whale was identified as a 5.68 m juvenile female through DNA profiling. The find is highly significant for whale scientists because very little was known about the species. The species is usually found in Indonesian waters, the Philippines, and the Sea of Japan. The whale has a sleek body shape and several unique skeletal features, including 53 vertebrae.

Some people believe that Hillary Clinton should not be president because of her hormones. Studies show that women leaders take fewer unnecessary risks than their male counterparts. The bias against women in the workplace is so well established that a female candidate will be hard-pressed to get elected. Equality benefits everyone.

Robert Hardy is selling his collection of antiques in a £100,000 auction. The actor is selling more than 
200 items he collected over his career. The auction is taking place at Dominic Winter's saleroom in South Cerney, Gloucestershire. The auction is set to take place this Saturday. The actor is selling items such as a 
diorama of the battle of Agincourt, furniture, paintings, and a longbow.

Michael Scott Shemansky is a suspect in the murder of his mother, Sandra Shemansky, who was found dead in their home. He is on the run from police since Saturday. He failed to appear for a supervised visit with his son on the same day his mother was found dead. He is on parole for battery on law enforcement and has a history of bipolar mental illness. Authorities have the murder weapon. He was last seen fleeing on foot.

Eugene in the United States has been awarded the rights to host the 2021 IAAF World Championships. The decision was made by the International Association of Athletics Federations Council, who decided to bypass the usual bidding process. Eugene failed in its bid to host the 2019 event, which was instead awarded to Doha. The 2007 World Championships held in Osaka, Japan was also awarded without a bidding process.

Leonie Granger was jailed for 16 years for manslaughter. She targeted Mehmet Hassan, a professional gambler, after spotting him at a casino. She befriended him and lured him back to his flat, where she left the door unlocked so her boyfriend and an accomplice could get inside. They tied up and kicked Hassan to death while ransacking his home for his winnings. Co-defendants Kyrron Jackson and Nicholas Chandler were found guilty of murder and jailed for life.

Cesc Fabregas is a chelsea midfielder who struggles during the second half of the season. The form of the player has dipped from the player who looked like he would break the Barclays Premier League record for assists. He has 
struggled to make an impact in midfield. He is a key player for the team.

West Ham is discussing a deal for Jamaican starlet Deshane Beckford after he impressed on trial. Beckford also has offers from clubs in Belgium. West Ham revealed season tickets at the Olympic Stadium will cost as little as £289.

Police dropped an investigation into an assault on Mike Lane, 40, three months after the attack. Lane was beaten by balaclava-clad protesters armed with iron bars on ropes. A video of the incident and a dossier of evidence were given to police after the assault. Lane was admitted to the hospital with concussion and broken teeth. Wiltshire police confirmed they had stopped the investigation pending further information.

Adam Gadahn, also known as Azzam the American, was killed in January in a U.S. government counterterrorism operation. He was known as the American mouthpiece of al qaeda. He was born in 
1978. He converted to Islam in 1995 and left the United States for Pakistan three years later. He was indicted in 2006 for treason and material support to al qaeda.

A viral video in China shows a five-year-old boy named Mai Zizhuo displaying basketball skills. He has been shooting hoops since he was two and a half years old. His skills have won him fans across China. Netizens have left thousands of comments.

Tom O'Carroll, a leading member of the Paedophile Information Exchange, has joined the supporters of the media pressure group Hacked Off. O'Carroll attended a Hacked Off rally in the Houses of Parliament on February 25 to lobby MPs for state involvement in media regulation. Hacked Off is campaigning against the independent press standards organization and wants MPs to set up a statutory body to regulate the press. O'Carroll was jailed in 1981 for "corrupting public morals".

The Bondi Icebergs Club pool was drained on Thursday to create a catwalk for Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week Australia. The empty pool was used as the catwalk setting for the ten pieces presentation. The label produces unisex collections of ten pieces designed to be worn in 20 different ways.

Bolton-born boxer Amir Khan spent his Friday at a safari park in northern California with his wife and daughter. Khan posed with and fed a white tiger, giraffes, and sea lions. Khan announced he will fight Chris Algieri on May 30.

A Palestinian teenager's name will be removed from an Israeli memorial after his family and others complained. The teenager's name appeared on the wall at Jerusalem's Mount Herzl, the site of the national cemetery. The teenager, Mohammed Abu Khdeir, was beaten and burned alive by three Israelis. His father objected to his inclusion on the memorial wall. An organization that works on behalf of victims of terror in Israel also opposes Abu Khdeir's inclusion on the memorial. Israel radio reported that the national insurance institute of Israel will remove Abu Khdeir's name from the memorial.

A California-based YouTube user named Lionel Hutz filmed his young son chasing the family cat around the garden in an attempt to rest. The cat licked his fur before the boy sat on top of him. After a moment, the cat moved to another spot, and the boy followed. The boy repeated the move one more time before the cat went indoors. A later video showed the boy feeding the cat treats.

Robert Kushner, a witness in a police corruption trial, lost his varsity coaching job at the Jack M. Barrack Hebrew Academy after testifying about his years selling marijuana. Kushner told jurors that undercover officers on trial had stolen $81,000 in cash and 7 pounds of marijuana from him during a 2007 arrest. He was arrested again in 2011 and sentenced to four years of probation and pleaded guilty to driving under the influence in 2008.

An explosion at a chemical plant in China's southeastern Fujian province caused a fire and injured six people. The plant produces paraxylene (PX), a reportedly carcinogenic chemical. The blast occurred at an oil storage facility after an oil leak. More than 600 firefighters were sent to battle the blaze and the fire is now under control. The plant was hit by another explosion in July 2013. The construction of PX plants has sparked protests in several cities in recent years.

Jack Grealish is known for wearing his socks low. He wears children's shinpads due to superstition and will continue to do so. Grealish made his first Premier League start for Aston Villa against QPR.

Bobbi Kristina Brown has "global and irreversible brain damage," according to her grandmother. She is no longer in a medically induced coma, but remains unresponsive. Doctors have indicated that she will have a long life, but the quality of her life will not be known for years to come.

Russia is on the brink of making the Fed Cup final with a 2-0 lead after Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova beat Germany's Sabine Lisicki. Pavlyuchenkova saved a match point in the second set before going on to beat Lisicki 4-6, 7-6 (4), 6-3, after Svetlana Kuznetsova beat Julia Goerges in straight sets in the opening rubber. The result left Russia needing one win from Sunday's three matches to reach the final.

Residents of New South Wales are warned to brace for more floods and damage. Early indicators show that an east coast low could hit the region, with heavy rain possible from Thursday. The state emergency service has over 4,000 jobs from the 24,196 requests still to be completed. The SES is concerned that more storms will hamper clean-up efforts.

Nina Moric, a model who appeared in the video for Ricky Martin's hit song La Vida Loco, told followers she did not try to take her own life and was treated in hospital after she collapsed due to low blood pressure. Italian media reported that Ms. Moric tried to take her own life and was found by her mother in the luxury apartment she shares with her boyfriend in Milan. Ms. Moric posted photographs on her Instagram account showing her injuries. Ms. Moric told her fans that she was recovering at home after being treated in hospital on Saturday night. Ms. Moric told her fans that she was well and had no intention to end her own life. She explained: `Saturday night i was taken to the hospital due to a domestic accident. i fell banging my head and i hurt everywhere because of low blood pressure.' Italian media claimed Ms. Moric had tried to take her own life in 2009 after taking an overdose. The Croatian-born model claimed she collapsed at home due to `low blood pressure'.

Diana is the favorite name for the second royal baby if it is a girl. 12 percent of people questioned thought the child should be named Diana. Alice and Charlotte were next in terms of preference, getting nine percent of the vote each. If the child is a boy, 13 percent of people would like him to be called James. 25 percent of the 2,200 people polled said they wanted the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge to have a female baby. 68 percent of people are backing William's decision to take six weeks paternity leave.

A suicide bomber detonated explosives near a group of protesters in eastern Afghanistan on Thursday, killing 17 people and wounding dozens more, police said. An Afghan lawmaker taking part in the protests was among the 64 people wounded. The Taliban denied responsibility for the attack. The suicide attack hit the group around 10 a.m. local time, police said.

Dani Alves will leave Barcelona this summer after rejecting the club's final contract offer. Alves has been unable to agree to a new deal with the club. Dinorah Santana, the player's agent, said that her client had rejected the offer of a three-year contract extension.

Pablo Osvaldo has urged Andrea Pirlo and Francisco Totti to join him at Boca Juniors. Osvaldo believes the duo would be a good fit for Boca and the fans would love to have them. Osvaldo thinks Pirlo and Totti would be perfect for Boca with their abilities.

Lewis Ferguson, 18, was mucking out the stables. He had a cut on his nose from a fall. Ferguson fell from his horse at Wincanton. He said it was a blur and he could not work out what had happened until he watched the replay. He was back riding out and is undeterred from getting back in the saddle.

James Haskell posted a photo on Instagram dressed as Iron Man. The Avengers movie premiered at the Westfield London Shopping Centre on Tuesday evening. Haskell returned to Wasps for the 2012 season. Haskell has played rugby in France, Japan, and New Zealand after leaving the Wasps in 2009. Since his return to England, Haskell has surpassed the 100 appearance mark for Wasps.

The wide leg trouser is at the forefront of SS15 trends. It is an alternative look to skinny jeans. The key is all in the shoe, a high heeled shoe with an exposed top of foot will elongate the leg. Denim is the easiest way to nail the trend. Celine and Stella McCartney kept it classy with a dressier-style pant. A wide billowing trouser silhouette will update your wardrobe this season.

The University of Michigan will proceed with a screening of the film "American Sniper" despite objections from some students. More than 200 students signed a petition asking the school not to show the movie. There was a backlash to the decision to cancel the movie, and a counter-petition asked school officials to reconsider. E. Royster Harper, University of Michigan's vice president for student life, said in a statement that it was a mistake to cancel the showing of the movie and that the show will go on. Umix will offer a screening of the family-friendly "Paddington" for those who would rather not attend "American Sniper."

Two French tourists tried to set a quokka alight on Rottnest Island off Perth in Western Australia on April 3. The quokka survived but was singed by the flame. The two men were charged with animal cruelty and will appear in court on April 17.
Alice Barker, a 102-year-old dancer from the 1930s and 1940s, was shown early music videos called "soundies" by Mark Cantor of jazz-on-film.com and some volunteers. Barker was delighted.

A study shows that washing your own car is dying out in Britain. A third of men have never washed their own car, and three-quarters of women never wash their own car. Drivers are more likely to take their car to a car wash. Factors behind the decline include shops opening on Sundays, more live football on TV, the rise of hand car washes, and 4x4 vehicles being too large to clean.

Martin Skrtel has praised Steven Gerrard's impact since arriving at Anfield in 2008. Gerrard is set to feature for Liverpool in the FA Cup semi-final against Aston Villa. Gerrard will sign off his Anfield career in the final on May 30, before moving to LA Galaxy. Skrtel believes Gerrard is still one of the best players in the world. Skrtel revealed that Gerrard helped him to settle at the beginning of his time at the club. Skrtel believes the club have potential replacements for Gerrard.
Jack Nicklaus, at 75, made a hole-in-one on the fourth during the par-3 contest at Augusta National. It was his first ace on the course. Camilo Villegas also made a hole-in-one on the fourth.

Tornado sirens blared Wednesday night in Kansas as several storms brought reports of twisters. Spotters reported a tornado about 6 miles northwest of Goddard. Other reports of tornadoes came in from southwestern Kansas. The National Weather Service indicated a tornado may have touched down in Potosi, Missouri. More storms are expected on Thursday in the midwest, Mississippi River Valley, Tennessee River Valley and near the southern Great Lakes.

Robert Bates pleaded not guilty to a charge of second-degree manslaughter. The judge granted Bates permission to go to the Bahamas for a family vacation. Bates' preliminary hearing is scheduled for 10 a.m. July 2. Bates, 73, was working as a reserve deputy for the Tulsa County Sheriff's Office on April 2 when he was involved in the arrest of Eric Harris. Bates claims he meant to stun Harris with a taser, but mistakenly shot Harris with a gun instead. Two deputies involved in the arrest of Harris have been reassigned because of threats against them and their families.

Conor McGregor is preparing for a featherweight title challenge against Jose Aldo on July 11. McGregor has a new tattoo of a tiger on his stomach. McGregor is challenging Jose Aldo for his featherweight champion title in Las Vegas on July 11.

Tony Abbott was criticized by anti-drinking campaigners for skolling a beer at an Australian rules function. Julie Robert said it was problematic that the prime minister would showcase his masculinity by skolling a beer. Abbott was asked to have a drink by university of technology sydney bats coach simon carradous and it took him about six seconds to down the schooner. Health minister Sussan Ley defended Abbott.

Saskia's boyfriend made her take an Arsenal test. She scored an impressive 87%, and as a result, the boyfriend did not dump her. The boyfriend was impressed with the end result, grading her an 'A'.

Carlos Toro, 66, worked for the DEA for 27 years as an undercover operative in exchange for US citizenship. He is now facing deportation after retiring. Toro was a mid-level member of the Medellin cartel in the 1980s. He provided information about his former bosses and associates. He helped carry out undercover stings around the world. He was not paid for his work, but was told he would be rewarded with US citizenship. The DEA refused to help Toro with his citizenship after he went public with his plight.
A 14-year-old girl in India set herself on fire after allegedly being raped by five men. She is in the hospital with 70% burns. The accused men have been arrested.

Manchester United manager Louis van Gaal says he has been dreaming of beating rivals City in Sunday's derby at Old Trafford but will have to do so without Robin van Persie. Van Gaal explained that van Persie is not yet fit enough to play. Van Gaal wants his side to move towards their target by taking all three points against City. The United boss also ruled out a potential return for Luke Shaw.

Arsenal and Liverpool fans left their seats empty at the Emirates Stadium for the first 10 minutes of their match in a protest against ticket prices. Supporters from both clubs say they are 'disgusted' at the continuing rise of ticket prices. Tickets at the sold-out Emirates started from £64 for the 12.45pm kick-off. Fans displayed a banner reading: '£5bn and what do we get? £64 a ticket'. Kelvin Meadows of Arsenal's Black Scarf Movement called ticket prices 'extortionate'. Roy Bentham of Spirit of Shankly said: 'we want tangible reductions in line with what working class people earn'. Further protests are expected after full-time at the Emirates.

Star Reader, a newborn baby, was diagnosed with biliary atresia and needed a liver transplant. Her mother's twin sister, Shanell Reader, offered part of her liver to save her niece's life. Star underwent the operation in November and has since made a good recovery.

Eden Hazard and three of his Chelsea teammates took part in Audi's football challenge. Hazard and Nathan Ake paired up to take on Loic Remy and Willian. In round one, Hazard and Ake won 5-3. The players were set to sink balls into convertible Audis from long range. Hazard and Ake won the decider to take a 6-0 lead after the first two rounds. Remy and Willian won the final game. Willian smashed the wing mirror off one of the Audis.

Robert Dellinger, a former Fortune 500 executive, caused a highway crash in December 2013 that killed a Vermont couple and their unborn baby. Dellinger, 54, pleaded guilty to negligent homicide and one count of assault for the fetus' death. He faces 12 to 24 years in prison. Dellinger told investigators he was trying to kill himself, but during his sentencing, he said he was not suicidal.

Lacey Spears was sentenced to 20 years to life in prison for the second-degree murder of her son, Garnett-Paul Spears, by poisoning him with salt. The boy's father, Chris Hill, expressed his hope that she would die in prison on Facebook. Prosecutors said Spears made her son ill because she had a bizarre need for attention. Spears' lawyer said she was innocent and blamed the hospital for negligence.

An improved vaccination will arrive in Australia to protect against influenza a strain h3n2 and influenza b strain b/phuket. Stocks of the influenza vaccine are arriving a month later than expected. High-risk groups will be able to access free, government-funded flu shots from April 20. The modified version of the vaccination is worth waiting for. The vaccine also provides protection against influenza a strain h1n1. There was a spike in deaths related to h3n2 and b/phuket in Europe and the US during the northern winter as the vaccine did not cover the strains. People should be booking their flu shots now, given the delay in stocks arriving.

Caretakers of Abraham Lincoln's tomb are on the defensive over an unflattering critique in National Geographic magazine and looming budget cuts that could threaten management of the historic site. The timing of a ceremony in Springfield to mark his death is awkward because Illinois faces a financial crisis. The popular tourist site was pilloried in this month's issue of National Geographic magazine as having 'all the historical character of an office lobby'. The tomb's interior plaster and paint, and bronze and marble construction were renovated last year. The state is currently working on waterproofing the receiving vault, repairing the stone structure 's interior, and landscaping to direct water away from the vault.

The nineties style is currently popular. The return of JNCO jeans has horrified many people. The bucket hat, camouflage print, taking it to the max, ugg boots, daisy dukes, juicy couture tracksuits, colored sunglasses, corsets as outfits, and harem trousers are all trends that should be left in the past.

Here's a summary of the trending stories: Four rainbows appeared in the New York area. Hiring exotic dancers at wakes in rural China is now a focus of the country's crackdown on vice. An interviewer from the UK asked about rdj's private life. The latest trend is lip plumping to look like Kylie Jenner. 102-year-old Alice Barker went back in time. A prom-posal referenced bombs. Ewan McGregor will play Lumiere in 'Beauty and the Beast'. Johnny Depp is nearly unrecognizable in the 'Black Mass' trailer. Someone announced they're pregnant by referencing "the fresh prince of bel-air." A military dad photobombed his son.

Serena Williams received a giant cake after her 700th career victory. Williams beat Sabine Lisicki in three sets to progress to the semi-finals of the Miami Open. Williams will face Simona Halep for a place in the final.

Sabeen Mahmud was shot dead by two gunmen after she locked up her second-floor cafe in Karachi for the night. She died from five bullet wounds. The gunmen also shot her mother, who is expected to be released from the hospital in time for her daughter's funeral. Mahmud had just finished leading a discussion group on a topic that many want silenced. She had received death threats in the past when she handled the topic before.

Mangu Ram, an 82-year-old, fled violence after the partition of India and is still considered a second-class citizen in Indian Kashmir. He is unable to own property or vote in state elections. However, after Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Hindu nationalist party won a share of power, there is hope that they will be able to shed their refugee status. Around 100,000 people are classified as refugees, despite most of them never visiting Pakistan, and living in the Jammu region of India. The West Pakistan refugees (WPRs) have been denied the right to own property or vote in state elections. The reluctance of successive state governments to grant full rights to the WPRs stems from fears of upsetting the demographic balance in India's only Muslim-majority state.

FC Tokyo forward Yoshinori Muto is considering whether to join Chelsea this summer. Chelsea has made an offer, believed to be around £4 million, for the Japan international. Muto wants to join a club where he will play regularly and realize his potential. Chelsea boss Jose Mourinho is aware of the Japan international.

Australia has dropped its policy of not selecting its best players if they are playing overseas. England needs to react and Stuart Lancaster must be free to pick his best players, no matter where in the world they play. The world cup is about the world’s best coming together and ridiculous rules like this demean it. England should support players who are happier, healthier, and better overseas. Selecting the best starting 15 is the first thing to get right. You can’t let the RFU or premier rugby dictate who you can or can’t pick.

Firechat is an app that allows users to chat without the need for the web or a mobile signal. Open Garden developers have built a small, egg-shaped device called Greenstone that acts as a beacon or booster to help messages move around wireless mesh networks. The Firechat app uses a feature that was launched in Apple's iOS 7 called multipeer connectivity framework (MCF). The app creates a localized network in which each phone becomes a node, and the data is passed between nodes. Greenstone has been designed to solve the limits of how far a message can travel.

Lillian Bustle, a burlesque performer from New Jersey, gave a TED talk where she embraced the word "fat" as a body-positive description of herself. She also calls herself "short" and "wife" because they are honest descriptions. She believes the word "fat" shouldn't be a synonym for "ugly". She started performing in 2012 and the experience has been empowering and body-positive. The response to her TED talk has been mostly positive.

Theo Walcott has been overlooked for the majority of the season. He was pictured for a photoshoot with Calum Chambers, Jack Wilshere, Mikel Arteta, David Ospina, Mathieu Flamini and Mesut Ozil. Walcott and his teammates posed for an official portrait for Lanvin, the club's official tailor since 2013. Arsenal's first team stars will be dressed in similar attire when they make their way to Wembley Stadium for their FA Cup final encounter against Aston Villa on May 30. Walcott has been named on Arsenal's substitutes' bench for 17 of their 33 Barclays Premier League games.

A collection of props and puppets created by make-up effects artist Rick Baker will be auctioned off at the Hilton Universal City in Los Angeles, California, and on propstore.com on May 29. The collection from Baker's Cinovation Studio is worth an estimated $746,100. The 417 original items are from more than 50 productions. Items from films like Men in Black, Batman Forever, How the Grinch Stole Christmas, and others will be sold.

A seven-year-old boy was skiing with his family when he became separated from his mother and fell to his death. The family of the seven-year-old boy said his death has left a ` vast void in their hearts.
Carwyn Scott-Howell was described as a ` daring , outgoing and determined ' youngster whose ` handsome smile lit up any room ' .
The schoolboy was skiing with his family when he became separated from his mother and headed into woodland where he fell over a 164ft drop.
The family of the boy, who was on holiday with his family, was skiing with his family when he became separated from his mother and headed into dense woodland where he fell over a 164ft drop.

Laura Scurr, a 15-year-old from Whitley Bay, developed anorexia after becoming obsessed with her weight. She was put on a heart machine after collapsing from starvation. She was living off just one piece of fruit a day and would hide her food. Laura, who is now 
recovering, has spoken about the pressures on young girls to be a size zero.

Liverpool supporters expect Raheem Sterling to remain at the club. The new kit is the first offering from New Balance, who struck a record-breaking £300 million four-year kit deal. The message was ` hold nothing back ' as sterling, daniel sturridge, martin skrtel and simon mignolet unveiled the new home strip to fans.

A team of researchers from the University of Manchester has produced the largest single high-definition map of dark matter. The map shows clumps of mystery particles across 0.4 percent of the sky. The goal is to eventually map 12.5 percent of the sky over five years. The map should allow astronomers to study how galaxies formed in the universe. The map was created using data captured by the dark energy camera, a 570-megapixel imaging device. The project is run as part of the five-year dark energy survey (DES).

Manchester United has made an official approach for PSV Eindhoven star Memphis Depay. The Eredivisie champions have confirmed that the Red Devils have made a move for the Holland international. Louis van Gaal is keen to make him one of his first signings this summer. Tottenham was keen on signing Depay last summer, but their offer of £15 million was rebuffed by PSV. Depay is enjoying a prolific season at the Philips Stadion, where he has scored 20 goals in 26 league games.
Chelsea took a 3-1 lead after a strong showing in Manchester. Dominic Solanke scored late on to put a gloss on the scoreline after a Tammy Abraham double. Tammy Abraham scored two goals.

Marco Rubio has claimed people are born with a sexual preference and believes state legislators should decide whether or not to allow gay marriage. He said he would attend the same-sex wedding of a family member or staffer, even if he didn't agree with the decision. He believes the definition of marriage should be between one man and one woman and does not believe same-sex marriage is a constitutional right.

Pablo Mandado and Ilze Zebolde are on an open- road cycling trip. They are traveling with no plans or agenda. In 356 days, they have covered almost 7,000 miles and been through 16 countries. They are living on less than three euros each a day. They keep costs down by relying on free accommodation. They usually pitch a tent under the stars and camp. They also use hosting websites. They started in London before heading southeast and working their way through France. They plan to continue into Asia.

A couple from Texas is suing James Evans, the owner of Premiere Photos, for allegedly printing a racial slur on the bottom of photo booth snapshots from their 2012 wedding. The couple's attorney, Cathy Hale, stated that the couple was not alerted of the photos until months after the celebration. Evans has denied all allegations and the couple is suing the company under the Texas Deceptive Trade Practices Act. Mediation is scheduled, and if an agreement is not reached, the case is set for trial in July. The couple wants an apology.

Mike Brown will take a cautious approach in recovering from his latest concussion setback. Brown is unsure when he will return after pulling out of Harlequins' Aviva Premiership clash with Saracens at Wembley. George North has been advised not to play again this season after suffering four quick-fire concussions. Brown was knocked out cold in England's 47-17 victory over Italy. Brown said increased awareness of the symptoms of concussion helped him realize he would not be ready to face Ireland.

The frequency with which Britons are having sex has been in decline since the emergence of the internet. A typical heterosexual couple was now having sex three times a month compared to four times a month in 2000 and five times a month in 1990. Possible factors for the decline in sexual activity include more people living on their own and lives becoming busier with the boundaries eroded between home, work, and the outside world.

Tibetan mastiffs, which can weigh up to 80 kg, were once status symbols and could sell for up to £1.2 million. Due to the Chinese government's anti-corruption crackdown and bans on owning dogs over 50 kg, the dogs are now unpopular and are being sent to slaughterhouses, with their meat being used in hotpots. Animal-welfare workers rescued a group of the dogs that were being transported to a slaughterhouse. The dogs' skin can also be used for leather belts.

Every woman surveyed in Paris claimed to have been a victim of some kind of sexual harassment on the city's public transport. Half of them were assaulted before they were 18 years old. The poll led to calls for a campaign to stem sexist or threatening behavior on buses and trains.

Direct Line is running a competition called #everydayfix. The competition asked groups to design products to deal with common problems. The top emergency was not being able to sleep. A group called instruments designed a product called `snooze', an alarm clock which connects with your phone and silences any notifications to ensure a good night's sleep. The forget me lock is a device to reassure you that you have locked the front door. The forget me lock fastens on the key and swivels green to show the door is open, and red to signify it's locked. The nipper is the world's smallest mobile phone charger. The nipper device is designed to help people who run out of battery while they are out and about.

Vera Baird, the police and crime commissioner for Northumbria, is facing a Ministry of Justice investigation after awarding over £500,000 of public money to Victims First Northumbria, a charity of which she is the director. Sue Sim, Northumbria's chief constable, is also on the charity's top table. Critics accuse them of creating a conflict of interest. The Ministry of Justice will investigate to determine if any conflict of interest rules were broken.

Three people have been sent to prison and another two are awaiting sentencing for their roles in an assault on a 53-year-old man. Corry 'Corey' Campbell, 21, was the ringleader of the gang, who have become known as the 'tattoo terrorists'. Campbell believed the victim, Greg Valecce, had hurt his cat. Valecce was beaten, tied to a chair, and covered in offensive tattoos. Campbell was sentenced to 20 years in state prison. Sandra Ng, 19, was sentenced to 23 months in state prison. Carl Halin received the same sentence as Campbell. David Thomas, 28, is awaiting sentencing, while another defendant Jennifer Pratt, 40, is awaiting trial.

Manchester United has made an official approach for PSV Eindhoven star Memphis Depay. Louis van Gaal is keen to make him one of his first signings this summer. Depay was in the 23-man world cup squad last year. Tottenham was keen on signing Depay last summer but saw their £15 million offer rebuffed by PSV. Depay has scored 20 goals in 26 league games this season.

As of March 13th, over 145,000 cases of COVID-19 have been confirmed in around 140 countries and territories, with major outbreaks in mainland China, Italy, South Korea, and Iran.
Between 29 and 52 Muslims were killed and more than 100 others wounded.
29 Muslims were killed and more than 100 others wounded.
