By 29 February Italy had performed more than 18,500 tests for the virus.
By 1 March Italy had performed 21,127 tests for the virus.

Qatar Airways is headquartered in the Qatar Airways Tower in Doha. The airline operates a hub-and-spoke network, linking over 160 international destinations across Africa, Central Asia, Europe, Far East, South Asia, Middle East, North America, South America and Oceania from its base at Hamad International Airport, using a fleet of more than 200 aircraft.

Qatar Airways is headquartered in the Qatar Airways Tower in Doha. The airline operates a hub-and-spoke network, linking over 150 international destinations across Africa, Central Asia, Europe, Far East, South Asia, Middle East, North America, South America and Oceania from its base at Hamad International Airport, using a fleet of more than 200 aircraft.
Maxthon is the second most popular browser in China and has been downloaded more than 400 million times worldwide.
Maxthon is the second most popular browser in China and has been downloaded more than 500 million times worldwide.
More than 16,700 people have died and more than 102,000 have recovered.
More than 392,000 cases have been reported worldwide; more than 17,100 people have died and more than 102,000 have recovered.

Paul Merson restarted his row with Andros Townsend after Townsend was brought on with only seven minutes remaining in his team's 0-0 draw with Burnley. Merson initially angered Townsend for writing in his Sky Sports column that 'if Andros Townsend can get in (the England team) then it opens it up to anybody.' Townsend was brought on in the 83rd minute for Tottenham as they drew 0-0 against Burnley. Townsend scored England's equaliser in their 1-1 friendly draw with Italy. Merson criticised Townsend's call-up to the England squad last week.

Chelsea has made an offer for FC Tokyo's 22-year-old forward Yoshinori Muto. If he completes a move to Stamford Bridge this summer, he will join Chelsea's Dutch partner club Vitesse Arnhem on loan next season. Muto has earned 11 caps for Japan and has scored once for the Samurai Blue. He scored 13 times in his debut season with FC Tokyo and was named in the J-League's best XI.

Babies given antibiotics in the first six months of life are more likely to be fat as toddlers. The Finnish researchers compared the weight and height of more than 12,000 healthy two year old with records on antibiotic prescription. By two years-old, one in five boys and one in ten girls was overweight or obese. Repeated prescriptions before the age of two also raised the odds of being a fat toddler. Boys seemed particularly prone weight gain after being given antibiotics. Antibiotic exposure before six months of age, or repeatedly during infancy, was associated with increased body mass in healthy children.

A Buckingham Palace guard slipped on a manhole cover during the Changing of the Guard. The incident was caught on camera by a tourist. The guard lost his footing, knocked his bearskin on the side of the box, and dropped his rifle. The incident took place in front of hundreds of tourists.

A&E networks are remaking the miniseries "Roots" to air in 2016. The three networks, A&E, Lifetime and History, will simulcast a remake of the saga of Kunta Kinte. LeVar Burton, who portrayed Kinte in the original, will co-executive produce the new miniseries. The new version will draw more from Alex Haley's classic novel, "Roots: The Saga of an American Family."

Police are investigating claims by a former royal footman that palace aides tried to force him into an orgy. Christopher Lawler said he was pinned to a chair and groped by a male member of staff on his first day working at Clarence House in January 1978. His complaints were ignored for months before the police were finally notified. A retired royal aide was reportedly interviewed but denied he was involved. The Royal Household would work ‘exhaustively and co-operatively’ with any police probe.

An Oregon couple, Jesse and Melissa Meek, announced they are expecting a child in a rap video set to the theme from '90s television sitcom 'The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air.' The clip has been viewed over 1.7 million times on YouTube. At the end of the video, the Meeks share a sonogram of their unborn child. It took five takes to film the clip.

A dress worn by Vivien Leigh in the 1939 film Gone With the Wind sold for $137,000 at auction. The dress, a jacket and full skirt ensemble, was worn in several key scenes. The dress was part of a collection of more than 150 items from the film that were auctioned on Saturday in Beverly Hills, California. Other items sold at the auction were a straw hat worn by Leigh that sold for $52,500; the trousers and jacket from a suit worn by Clark Gable as Rhett Butler, selling for $55,000; and a black bonnet worn by both Leigh and Olivia De Havilland as Melanie Wilkes, which fetched $30,000.

A two-year-old boy fell into a cheetah exhibit at the Cleveland Metroparks Zoo after his parents dangled him over the edge. The child was rescued by his parents before firefighters and paramedics arrived. He suffered from minor bumps and bruises and was listed in stable condition at the hospital. The boy's leg was injured in the fall, but he was not attacked by the animals. Cleveland Metroparks Zoo has plans to press child endangerment charges against the family. The exhibit was closed following the child's fall.

A speed camera was angled directly on a house's front door. The speed camera has not been working for more than two years. Around 300 speed and traffic cameras were turned off across the region in March 2013. A spokesman for Birmingham City Council said they were aware of it. One of their engineers will now be visiting the site and the camera could be removed completely. There were no plans to include the camera in Wellington Road in the new pilot.
Usain Bolt will compete at the IAAF/BTC World Relays in the Bahamas on May 2 and 3 as part of the Jamaican team.

Neymar and Dani Alves supported Barcelona's basketball side. Barca won 85-80 in the Euro League contest. Real Madrid is at the top of their Euro League division. Neymar helped Brazil beat Chile 1-0. Barcelona won their El Clasico contest to move four points clear at the top of La Liga. Neymar and his Barcelona team-mates return to La Liga on Sunday, taking on Celta Vigo.

From Friday to Monday, a total of 8,480 migrants were rescued. The Italian coast guard received SOS calls from 20 boats in distress on Monday. A spokesman with Save the Children told CNN the group fears 400 migrants could be missing. The Italian coast guard cannot confirm such an incident and has not yet found evidence at sea to indicate a migrant boat carrying approximately 550 has capsized with 145 rescued. Italy registered more than 10,000 migrants arriving in the first three months of 2015. About 2,000 were rescued at sea during the first weekend of April in the Channel of Sicily. Most migrants recorded this year come from countries in West Africa as well as Somalia and Syria. At least 480 migrants have died while crossing the Mediterranean since the beginning of the year. Last week: 978 migrants rescued in one day in Mediterranean Sea.

Alexis Sanchez chose Arsenal over other clubs. Sanchez has made an instant impact in English football and has scored 19 goals so far this season. Wenger was aware of Liverpool's interest in Sanchez. Wenger believes the way Sanchez has adapted so quickly to a change in environment proves he is one of the best around. Wenger has been impressed by the way Brendan Rodgers has developed his team following the sale of Suarez and injury to striker Daniel Sturridge.

Sir Bradley Wiggins will bid for cycling's hour record on June 7 at London's Olympic Velodrome. The four-time Olympic champion and 2012 Tour de France winner will attempt to ride the furthest distance in 60 minutes at the Lee Valley VeloPark. The current Hour record is 52.491km, set by Australian Rohan Dennis in February. Tickets will go on sale from April 19.

Serena Williams beat Sara Errani in the Fed Cup. Williams said it was a real "eye-opener" as the claycourt season gets into full swing. The US were beaten 3-2 as Williams and Alison Riske were thrashed in the doubles rubber by Errani and Flavia Pennetta, meaning they were relegated to World Group II.

River Plate are keen to sign Radamel Falcao. Falcao spent eight years with the Argentine side before leaving for Porto in 2009 and River Plate are open to Falcao returning. River Plate vice president Matias Patanian said: 'We dream of Falcao Garcia. The doors are open.' Falcao scored 34 goals in 90 appearances for the Argentine club.

Ella Henderson, the X Factor finalist and pop star, has joined forces with dry shampoo brand Batiste. The 19-year-old is the official face of Batiste's 2015 'Ready For It' campaign, which marks the star's first brand collaboration. The campaign launched with a TV advertising campaign, featuring the singer's latest single, Mirror Man.

A billboard featuring officer Pablo Torres and his dog was erected in Kenosha, Wisconsin. Aaron Siler was fatally shot by officer Pablo Torres on March 14 after Siler armed himself with a weapon. Siler's family and friends are in shock and have called the billboard "disrespectful". The Kenosha Professional Police Association claims that no offense was intended and that the billboard was simply to thank the community for its support. Torres is currently on leave pending the outcome of the investigation into the deadly shooting.

Eight Iranian border guards were killed in clashes with militants near the border with Pakistan. Three of the militants were killed by Iranian forces. The militants crossed into the country from Pakistan. A militant group called Jaish al Adal claimed responsibility for the attack. Jaish al Adal is an anti-Iranian group that has emerged during recent years in areas of Balochistan. The Pakistani government condemned Monday's attack, calling it an "act of terrorism."

Japan's Air Self Defense Force (ASDF) has never encountered an extraterrestrial unidentified flying object. Defense Minister Gen Nakatani told the Diet that his jets had never come across any UFOs from outer space. Former wrestler-turned-lawmaker Antonio Inoki asked if aircraft were ever scrambled to meet extraterrestrial threats, and if research was being done into alien visitors. Inoki claims to have seen a UFO with his own eyes. In 2007 then-Defense Minister Shigeru Ishiba pondered the legal ramifications, under Japan's pacifist constitution, of a defense against an invasion from outer space.

A passenger was hospitalised with deep cuts after breaking a toilet he was squatting on in Hefei Xinqiao International Airport. The passenger was standing on the rim of the toilet because he was worried it might not be clean. The toilet collapsed, cutting the man in several places. He received several dozens stitches on his left leg and buttocks. Authorities said they believed the incident was an accident.

Japanese photographer Yûki Aoyama's images capture teenagers next to their fathers leaping into the air. The images are from the 37-year-old's latest book which roughly translates into Daughter and Salary Man. Each image sees the daughter wearing casual clothing with her father in a sharp suit. The pictures see the families pose in front of various Japanese landmarks.

Paul Downton was dismissed as England's managing director. Kevin Pietersen posed for the Surrey team photo before the start of the new campaign. Pietersen was axed by the former managing director in 2014. Pietersen has rejoined Surrey in an attempt to force his way back into the Test set-up. Surrey play Oxford MCCU in a MCC University match on Sunday. Surrey is set to begin their campaign at Glamorgan on April 19.

Ceahlaul Piatra Neamt sacked Brazilian coach Ze Maria for the second time in a week. Ze Maria was fired on Wednesday, reinstated the next day, and then fired again after Ceahlaul were beaten 2-0 by FC Botosani on Saturday. Ze Maria represented Brazil 25 times. The result left Ceahlaul 16th in the standings. Ze Maria replaced Florin Marin in January and will be replaced by Serbian Vanya Radinovic.

Radamel Falcao's former Monaco team-mate Nabil Dirar believes the Colombian must be regretting his failed loan move to Manchester United. Falcao moved to Old Trafford on a season-long loan last summer but has struggled to hit the heights he achieved before suffering a serious knee injury. United will have to pay £46million to make Falcao's transfer permanent but are unlikely to take up that option. Falcao was not happy in France but thinks he would have been better off staying at Monaco.

A man wearing a cartoon mask robbed a Christchurch dairy on Saturday. The man is described as being 'very tall' and was wearing a fluoro orange sweatshirt. He made off with the till and about $1500 in cash. Police were called to the Union St dairy at about 12.30pm. Police are asking anyone with information to call Crimestoppers or message police online.

Kaitlyn Granado, 24, was arrested on Monday for allegedly having sex with a 15-year-old pupil in her car on consecutive nights in January. Granado, a math teacher at MacArthur High School in Irving, was first arrested on March 19 for having an inappropriate relationship with a 15-year-old student. She was released on bail and then arrested again after another 15-year-old pupil accused her of having sex with him on two consecutive nights in January. Granado was booked into Irving County Jail for the second time on Monday and released after posting a $50,000 bail. She was suspended from teaching and put on administrative leave by school officials.

A video of a crocodile swimming through a marina with a dead dog in its mouth has been viewed more than 500,000 times. The dog belonged to the local bike shop's owner. The crocodile kept the dog in its mouth for hours. Crocodiles are a common site in Puerto Vallarta.

Steve Bruce is confident he can keep Hull City in the Premier League this season and avoid relegation. Hull were beaten 2-0 by Southampton. They now have six games to save their season. Bruce puts their struggles down to several long-term injuries to key players. Ronald Koeman's side moved to fifth in the table. Koeman will speak to his squad to remind them that team rules cannot be broken by anyone.

Ian Guffick, a teacher at Mitton Manor Primary School, was banned from the classroom after he let pupils change their exam answers, which invalidated the school's SATs results. Guffick also altered some of the pupil's exam answers himself. The Department for Education annulled all SATs exam results for the entire school. Guffick was banned from the classroom for at least two years.

Anders Lindegaard married Misse Beqiri last year in Mauritius and they have a son together. Lindegaard has struggled for minutes throughout his career in Manchester. Beqiri regularly posts modeling photos on her Instagram page. Lindegaard and Beqiri have been dating since 2012. Lindegaard moved to the Premier League in 2010. Lindegaard is now third-choice at Old Trafford.

The 13 letters that hung over Yankee Stadium failed to find a buyer at a Sotheby's auction. The letters were estimated to bring in $300,000 to $600,000, but the only bid was for $260,000 from a Sotheby's employee. The current owner of the signage is Reggie Jackson, who purchased the letters after the stadium's final game in 2008. The letters had been installed in 1976 and taken down in 2008. A New York Mets bullpen car was also auctioned off and received a winning bid of $112,500.

Brendan Rodgers spoke to Raheem Sterling and Jordon Ibe about their professional responsibilities. Sterling was exposed for inhaling nitrous oxide and was pictured with a shisha pipe. Ibe was also pictured with a shisha pipe. Rodgers will not discipline either player. Steven Gerrard is available for the FA Cup semi-final with Aston Villa.

Mesut Ozil posted a picture on Twitter relaxing with his dog on Wednesday after returning home to London. Ozil impressed on international duty as Germany beat Gerogia 2-0 in a Euro 2016 qualifier on Sunday. The midfielder missed Arsenal's last game against Newcastle through illness, but will be expected to start against Liverpool at the Emirates Stadium. The playmaker has been in fine form since returning from injury for Arsenal this year.

Barcelona club president Josep Maria Bartomeu says the club has no plans to replace Luis Enrique and they're 'very happy' with him. Enrique took charge of the club last summer, signing a two-year-deal, and has impressed during his tenure. Enrique has a contract until 2016.

Jordan Henderson has agreed to a new long-term contract with Liverpool. The new deal will run to 2020 and is worth around £100,000-a-week. Henderson is the third player to agree to a contract extension. Henderson could replace Steven Gerrard as Liverpool captain. Talks with Raheem Sterling are expected to resume in the summer.

Filipe Luis wants to stay at Chelsea until the end of his contract. Atletico Madrid is considering bringing him back in the summer. Luis signed a three-year contract last July. Chelsea manager Jose Mourinho wants the team to be focused and concentrate in the matches.

Nathan Hughes's ban for accidentally knocking out George North was overturned on appeal. Hughes was initially suspended for three matches after a disciplinary panel ruled he had been ‘reckless’. Hughes was shown a red card for the offense, but that dismissal has now been officially rescinded. The appeal lodged by Wasps was up-held. Hughes's knee collided with North's head as he crossed the line to score for Northampton. North was left unconscious by the clash. Hughes missed his side's Champions Cup quarter-final loss against Toulon last Sunday. Hughes is now free to return to action immediately. Jeremy Summers, chairman of the appeal hearing panel, said the panel concluded that no act of foul play took place in that the incident occurred accidentally.

Fiery sunsets were seen in Washington on Sunday. The sunsets were the result of wildfires in Siberia. The fires were started by farmers burning grass in their fields. The flames grew out of control because of strong winds and spread throughout the region. The smoke was carried by atmospheric winds across the Pacific Ocean to the Pacific Northwest. The reason for the intense red sunset is a result of smoke particles filtering out the shorter wavelength colors from the sunlight. As the smoke starts to dissipate, the sunsets will lose their reddish hue.

Becky Schoenig's 2015 Ford Fusion was stolen from her driveway and returned with red rims, red detailing, and orange accents on the steering wheel. She posted a photo of the car on Facebook, thanking the thieves. The car had a strong smell of cigarettes and marijuana and is being professionally cleaned. She is creating a smoothie to honor the man who located her car.

Manchester City players will lose £500,000-a-man in bonuses if they fail to qualify for the Champions League this season. The City squad have around £12million resting on reaching their European target. The top three finishers in the Premier League qualify automatically for the Champions League with the fourth-place team required to win a qualifying round to join them. City are in fourth place.

Manchester United's Under 18s defeated City 1-0 in the 'mini-derby'. Callum Gribbin scored the match-winning goal for Manchester United with a free-kick. Entry to the match was free. The result leaves United two points behind leaders Middlesbrough with a game in hand. City has lost both matches in the Barclays Under 18s Premier League end-of-season play-off series.

Joe Hart called Gianluigi Buffon a 'legend of the game' after Buffon claimed his 147th cap. Hart represented his country for the 50th time. Hart said Buffon was an inspiration. Hart is 10 years younger than Buffon.

Chipotle is teaming up with the Postmates app to offer delivery for online and mobile orders in 67 cities. The delivery fees for Postmates begin at $5 and up, depending on distance and demand, with a nine percent service charge. Hillary Clinton and Marco Rubio have been spotted in Chipotle restaurants.

The parents of the youngest victim of the Boston Marathon bombings are asking to take the death penalty off the table for the man convicted in the case. Dzhokhar Tsarnaev was found guilty on all 30 charges. The Richards are urging the Justice Department to bring the case to a close. Martin Richard and two others were killed and more 200 people wounded when a pair of bombs went off at the finish line on April 15, 2013.

A jumbo jet was converted into a luxury home for a billionaire. The custom-built Boeing 747 cost £400 million. It was built for one tycoon, but can fit dozens of guests. It contains a dining room, lounge, 'state room', and an 'aeroloft' with eight beds.

SpaceX launched a Falcon 9 rocket carrying an uncrewed cargo spacecraft called Dragon to the International Space Station. The rocket landed on a droneship, but tipped over. The Dragon will dock with the space station to deliver supplies. The space station crew will then fill it with items to send back to Earth. This is the sixth SpaceX mission to the International Space Station.

Priscilla Presley will be a witness at the first wedding at the new Elvis Presley's Graceland Wedding Chapel inside the Westgate Hotel on April 23. The winning couple will win a free wedding reception, a hotel suite for two nights, airfares, and concert tickets to the Elvis Experience theater show. Couples must submit a video or photos along with an explanation detailing why they deserve the prize.

Liverpool vice-captain Jordan Henderson thinks his side could catch Manchester City in the Premier League. Henderson played his 47th game of the season in the 2-0 win over Newcastle United on Monday night. Raheem Sterling opened the scoring in the ninth minute at Anfield. Joe Allen scored his first Anfield goal to make it 2-0 with 20 minutes to go.

Roma defeated Napoli in Serie A, ending a four-month winless streak at home. Miralem Pjanic scored in the 25th minute, and goalkeeper Morgan de Sanctis made several saves. Roma moved four points ahead of Lazio. Napoli's winless streak was extended to five matches. Security was tight, and 1,000 police officers were called in.
Doncaster Rovers played Fleetwood Town in a goalless draw at the Keepmoat Stadium. The match highlights were 27 seconds long with 14 seconds of match action.

A man interacts with his blood parrot cichlid by stroking and massaging it in the fish tank. The fish enjoys the interaction and returns to the man's hand. The man removed other fish from the tank because they were bullying the blood parrot cichlid. The man feeds the fish by hand and plays with it for at least 15 minutes each day. The blood parrot cichlid is a hybrid of the midas and the redhead cichlid and was first bred in Taiwan around 1986.

Ben Stokes is known as a fiery character in the England cricket team. He clashed with Marlon Samuels during the second Test between West Indies and England. Stokes broke his wrist punching a locker after being dismissed last year. Only a slight niggle in his back might stop Stokes playing in Barbados. England must make sure they do not quash that natural exuberance and desire to take someone on. England wants to have Stokes in the team as much as possible to help him hit his full potential.

Wales' Euro 2016 qualifier with Belgium on June 12 at the Cardiff City Stadium has been declared a 33,000 sell-out. Wales and Belgium both have 11 points from five games. The Football Association of Wales said general admission tickets for the match have now sold out. The Wales squad prefer to play at the Cardiff City Stadium rather than the Millennium Stadium.

England coach John Peacock has named his squad for next month's UEFA European Under-17 Championship in Bulgaria. The Young Lions are the defending champions. They have been placed in Group D alongside Holland, Italy and the Republic of Ireland and will open their campaign against Italy in Burgas on May 7. The squad contains talented young players from a host of Premier League clubs including Jay Dasilva and Ike Ugbo of Chelsea and the Arsenal duo Chris Willock and Stephy Mavididi, who is called up for the first time. Their other matches are against Holland on May 10 and Ireland on May 13.

Manchester City are keen to sign Anderlecht teenager Evangelos Patoulidis. The 14-year-old playmaker has also attracted attention from Arsenal and Barcelona. City have held discussions with Anderlecht chairman Roger Vanden Stock in the hope of agreeing a compensation package.

A 23-year-old man was arrested in connection with the death of Vanessa Santillan, a 33-year-old transgender escort. Her body was found in a flat in Fulham, south west London, at the end of March. She died as a result of injuries to the head and neck. The London Ambulance Service was called to a flat in Romily Court, Fulham, on March 28 at around 9.30pm. She worked in London, Paris and Miami as an escort.

Dawn, who had seven miscarriages, appeared on The Jeremy Kyle show after a family friend stole money set aside for her baby's gravestone. The money, £207, was for a gravestone that would cost £500. A lie detector test revealed that Jamie, who lives with Dawn and her partner, had taken the cash. Dawn burst into tears and stormed off.

ISIS released more than 200 Yazidis on Wednesday. Most of those released were women and children, the rest were ill or elderly. Arab tribal leaders helped to coordinate the release. 217 Yazidis were released, according to one official, while another reported 228. ISIS previously released scores of other Yazidis since attacking the group's towns last year.

Harry Kane is nominated for both the PFA Player and Young Player of the Season. He is featured in a new animation that features some of Kane's best goals and celebrations from the season. The video is entitled 'Harry Kane - PFA Player of the Year?'.

Jamie Carragher believes Brendan Rodgers is still the right man to lead Liverpool forward. Rodgers' future at Anfield has been questioned after a third straight season without a trophy. Liverpool are seven points behind fourth placed Manchester City with a game in hand and look set to miss out on Champions League qualification for next season. Carragher received a Beacon Award for his community work on Merseyside.

Four-year-old James Hayward had his toy gun confiscated at East Midlands Airport. Security officers took exception to James's toy gun when it was picked up on the system's X-ray machines. The airport apologized for the inconvenience but pointed out they had offered to post the toy back to the family's home. East Midlands Airport said that 'no items may be permitted through security that resemble a prohibited item'.

A man named Rich, who lives in Humpty Doo, Northern Territory, posted an advertisement on Gumtree looking for a girlfriend or wife. The advertisement detailed his requirements for a partner and personal details about himself. The successful applicant must enjoy the outdoors, but is also a princess when need to be. Rich is 31 years old, athletic build, white, heavily tattooed, brown hair, brown eyes, doesn't drink, doesn't smoke, and doesn't do drugs. He is 175cm tall, well endowed, owns his own property(s), makes great money, loves cars and bikes, and is very independent. The potential partner would receive lots of benefits.

Greg Dyke wants to increase the minimum number of home-grown players in club squads from eight to 12, but he is facing opposition from the Premier League. The proposals also include changing the rules so that 'home-grown' means having trained in England for three years before the age of 18 rather than before 21. Graham Taylor, Glenn Hoddle, Kevin Keegan, Sven-Goran Eriksson and Steve McClaren have signed a letter addressed to Dyke. The five former Three Lions bosses warn the English game will suffer if it blocks the proposals from Dyke and the FA's England Commission. Only 81 of the 220 Premier League starters in the last round of matches were eligible for England selection.

Demelza Poldark is now the proud mother to the show’s latest addition. Within ten minutes of tomorrow night’s episode, fans will see Aidan Turner’s Ross Poldark gaze lovingly at his new baby daughter. Demelza talks about being eight months pregnant at the start of tomorrow’s instalment. She is giving birth minutes later.

Leicester manager Nigel Pearson has urged Leicester to keep their cool and ignore their relegation rivals. The Foxes host Swansea on Saturday just three points from safety in the Barclays Premier League after back-to-back wins. Jamie Vardy scored an injury-time winner against West Bromwich Albion on Saturday. Pearson wants his side to remain focused on their own jobs.

Varvara, a North Pacific gray whale, swam nearly 14,000 miles, which is the longest migration of a mammal ever recorded. Varvara left her feeding ground off Russia's Sakhalin Island to cross the Pacific Ocean and down the West Coast of the United States to Baja, Mexico. Varvara visited "three major breeding areas for eastern gray whales." Varvara was thought to be an endangered western whale, but her journey could mean that some western gray whales are actually eastern grays.

Overnight, 1,000ft of seabed rose to the surface on the east coast of Japan's Hokkaido Island. The land rose as high as 50ft from the sea surface. Geologists believe a landslide caused the underwater area to rise. The mass measures roughly 1,000- 1,640ft long, and 100ft wide. Local residents did not hear any sounds or feel tremors. Authorities do not expect the land to expand further.

Gregory van der Wiel denied claims that he is set to leave Paris Saint-Germain in the summer and reiterated his 'love' for the club. He had a falling out with his boss Laurent Blanc after being dropped for the Champions League clash against Chelsea. Van der Wiel is happy in Paris and is making no plans to leave the Ligue 1 side. He wants to sign a new contract. The Parisians continue to be linked with Barcelona star Dani Alves.

Carlos Tevez has been told to terminate his contract with Juventus to complete a return to Boca Juniors. Tevez's deal with Juventus does not expire until the end of next season, but he has reportedly told the club he wishes to leave this summer. Boca have confirmed they are close to completing a deal for the 31-year-old, but club president Daniel Angelici has stressed that Tevez must terminate his contract with the Italians first. Tevez has always said he intends to finish his career back at his first club Boca Juniors in Argentina.

Bayern Munich manager Pep Guardiola ripped a hole in his trousers during the Champions League match in Germany. Guardiola's underwear were on show after the Bayern boss managed to rip a small hole in his trousers. Bayern managed to book a place in the Champions League semi-finals thanks to goals by Thiago Alcantara, Jerome Boateng, Thomas Muller, Xabi Alonso and a brace from Robert Lewandowski. Bayern won 6-1 against Porto.

Ten people, including four children, were involved in a multi-vehicle crash on the Brisbane Valley Highway, 2km south of Fernvale. A 40-year-old man with chest and shoulder injuries and a five-year-old boy with chest pain were flown to the Princess Alexandra Hospital. A 27-year-old woman with arm injuries and a six-year-old girl suffering from abdominal pain were also flown out. Six others, including an infant and two young girls, were taken to Ipswich Hospital with minor injuries or for further assessment. A man suffered hand lacerations and two females escaped injuries. The highway has been closed off, with diversions in place south of Fernvale.

Arsenal will host Chelsea. Mesut Ozil received an Apple Watch. Ozil compared his watch to TV character Michael Knight in the hit action show Knight Rider. Jack Wilshere has returned to the team. Ray Parlour believes Wilshere is the future of the club.

Mark Clattenburg will officiate the Manchester derby between United and City at Old Trafford. The English referee sent off City and Belgium captain Vincent Kompany during the international break. Clattenburg has shown only two red cards this season, both to United players including Luke Shaw.

Bob Katter accused the Queensland Government of believing MP Billy Gordon was 'a little black puppet on a string'. Mr. Gordon was accused of domestic violence and withholding his criminal history. Mr. Gordon will remain in the Queensland parliament as an independent. Mr. Katter defended the statement, saying he used the term black puppet in light of his personal experiences.

Dayna Dobias, 19, from Downers Grove, Illinois, was born with cerebral palsy. She hopes to inspire others with her videos. She has created a video in which she dances. She has also begun to do some motivational speaking at a couple of local schools.

Orlando City has expressed interest in Javier Hernandez. Hernandez is linked with a move to Orlando City after a loan spell at Real Madrid. Eight European sides are also interested. Southampton, Stoke, West Ham and Everton are all interested. Wolfsburg, AC Milan, Lazio and Inter Milan are also keen on the 26-year-old. Manchester United have made a revised contract offer to 19-year-old Andreas Pereira. Paris St Germain, Juventus, PSV Eindhoven and Feyenoord have all made contact with the midfielder's father Marcos.

At a California gas station early Saturday morning, a group of at least three people poured gasoline on a car and set it on fire. The driver of the car got into an argument with the suspects while pumping gas. The group covered his white Dodge Charger in gasoline and lit it ablaze while there were two passengers inside. The passengers and the driver were not hurt during the incident but the car was completely ruined. The suspects attempted to carjack the man. The Los Angeles County Fire Department is investigating the incident as an arson and the suspects remain at large.

A southern Iowa chiropractor, Charles Manuel, surrendered his state license after admitting to swapping services for sex and performing exorcisms on patients. Manuel signed an agreement and pledged not to apply for reinstatement for at least 10 years. He also recommended that patients stop taking medication he prescribed to them. Manuel received a perfect five out of five stars in patient satisfaction on HealthGrades.com.

A U.S. reconnaissance plane was intercepted by a Russian fighter jet in an "unsafe and unprofessional manner" over the Baltic Sea. The U.S. is complaining to Moscow about the incident. The Pentagon said the incident occurred in international airspace north of Poland. The U.S. crew believed the Russian pilot's actions were "unsafe and unprofessional due to the aggressive maneuvers it performed in close proximity to their aircraft and its high rate of speed." A year ago, a Russian jet flew within 100 feet of a RC-135U over the Sea of Okhotsk in the western Pacific.

An FBI agent's sniper rifle was stolen from a Salt Lake City hotel parking lot. The gun was inside a hard rifle case and was 'secured properly' to a truck safe with padlocks and chains. The thief broke the rear right passenger-side window, tied a rope around the rifle case's handle or a cable lock, and used the momentum from another vehicle to break the case's handle free from the lock. The agent's gear bag, backpack, and some clothing and tools were also stolen. The theft happened overnight from the parking lot of Marriott Springhill Suites. The agent's bags and some of his clothing were found at a Residence Inn across the street, but the sniper rifle has not been recovered. The hotel does not have surveillance cameras. The rifle's serial number has been entered into the National Crime Information Computer. The Secret Service was notified about the stolen rifle before President Obama's visit.

Luigi Costa, 71, is accused of killing his elderly neighbor Terrence Freebody in July 2012. Costa was believed to be suffering from dementia and alcohol abuse at the time of the murder. Professor Paul Mullen examined Costa after the attack and believes there was evidence of the accused's state of mind declining in the lead-up to the incident and also during the event. The jury can return a not guilty verdict if Costa's unstable mindset at the time of the attack can be proven.

Ross Barkley missed a penalty in Everton's 1-0 win against Burnley. Barkley took the 10th minute kick instead of Leighton Baines, who has scored 15 penalties from 16 attempts in the Premier League. Martinez said Barkley was within his rights to request penalty-taking duties. Barkley's penalty was saved by Burnley goalkeeper Tom Heaton. Kevin Mirallas scored the only goal of the game after 29 minutes.

Two passengers were found dead on a cruise ship in Puerto Rico and appear to have died in a murder-suicide. The guests were found dead inside their stateroom on the ms Ryndam at 11:30 a.m. Thursday. The ship left Tampa, Florida, on March 29 on a 14-day Southern Caribbean cruise and is currently in San Juan, Puerto Rico.

Patrick Kluivert, coach of Curacao, has made a winning start in World Cup qualifying. Curacao advanced to the second qualifying round in CONCACAF for the 2018 tournament. Curacao drew 2-2 in a second-leg match at Montserrat to win 4-3 on aggregate. Curacao face Cuba in the next round, on June 8 and 16.

Esteban Cambiasso says that helping keep Leicester in the Premier League will feel like winning a trophy. Cambiasso had an illustrious career at Inter Milan, winning 15 trophies during his stint. Cambiasso signed for the Foxes in the summer after leaving Italy and has established himself as a key player. Cambiasso is happy in the East Midlands and could stay beyond his current one-year-deal.

Gemma, a 23-year-old mother of two, may be banned from seeing her children by her mother, Debbie. Debbie took care of the children when they were four months old. Debbie is threatening to ban Gemma because of her drinking, partying, and use of legal highs. Debbie also suspects Gemma of stealing.

Eden Hazard scored to give Chelsea a 1-0 lead against Manchester United. Chelsea captain John Terry had a strong challenge from behind on United striker Radamel Falcao. Pundits Thierry Henry, Jamie Redknapp and Graeme Souness agreed that play should have been stopped for Terry's rough tackle on Falcao.

Hillary Scott's tour bus caught fire on a Texas freeway, but everyone on board was safely evacuated. The fire destroyed everything in the bus's back lounge except her Bible. The band's two other members were not traveling on the bus. Lady Antebellum is set to perform at the 50th Academy of Country Music Awards on Sunday in Arlington, Texas.

Dr. Adrian Quarterman is working on a laser that will convert sun beams into energy. The satellites will orbit the earth, covered in mirrors to help it harvest the sunlight and convert it into laser light. The energy it then creates, using semi-conductors, can be shot back down to earth. Initial trials in Scotland were successful, but Dr Quarterman is now hoping to move the trials to Portugal. Researchers at the Riken research institute in Tokyo have proposed a laser system to attach to the ISS which would be used to shoot down pieces of debris in Earth orbit.

A Los Angeles judge ordered V. Stiviano to pay back more than $2.6 million in gifts after Donald Sterling's wife sued her. Shelly Sterling accused Stiviano of targeting extremely wealthy older men. Donald Sterling used the couple's money to buy Stiviano a Ferrari, two Bentleys and a Range Rover, and that he helped her get a $1.8 million duplex. Donald Sterling's downfall came after an audio recording surfaced of him arguing with Stiviano. NBA Commissioner Adam Silver banned Sterling from the league, fined him $2.5 million and pushed through a charge to terminate all of his ownership rights in the franchise.

Thierry Henry criticized Arsenal's recent transfer dealings and urged them to purchase a goalkeeper, centre back, defensive midfielder, and striker. Henry believes Arsenal will struggle to win the league if Olivier Giroud remains the club's first-choice striker. Henry said Arsenal needs to sign players of a similar caliber to Thibaut Courtois, Nemanja Matic, Cesc Fabregas, and Diego Costa.

Serge Gnabry is feeling better as the Arsenal teenager prepares to return after more than a year out due to a serious knee injury. Gnabry played 90 minutes for Arsenal Under 21s against Reading on Monday. Gnabry has not featured for the first team since March last year.

Jacob Phillips, 23, fell 70ft to his death from a cliff after running from a taxi to avoid paying the fare. He had been out drinking with friends and they did not have enough money to pay the taxi fare. He ran from the taxi driver and fell from the cliff at the end of the disused Northern Promenade. His body was discovered the next day. The coroner recorded a verdict of accidental death.

Thousands of holidaymakers caught up in last summer’s passport delay fiasco have not received any compensation. Managers at the passport agency received up to £3,500 in bonuses while the agency made a £42 million profit. Ministers refused to give a blanket refund to families. Just 2,191 compensation applications were approved between April last year and January this year. The total paid out was £203,066.

A three-bedroom home in Horfield, Bristol, which has remained unchanged since the 1930s is for sale with original features including stained-glass windows, oil-fired central heating, and retro jars of food. The semi-detached property has a guide price of between £200,000 and £250,000 and will be auctioned on April 30 at the County Ground in Bristol.

Colin Kaepernick began his professional career as a backup to Alex Smith, but became the 49ers' starter in the middle of the 2012 season after Smith suffered a concussion. He remained the team's starting quarterback for the rest of the season and went on to lead the 49ers to their first Super Bowl appearance since 1994, losing to the Baltimore Ravens.
Soul Food is a 1997 American comedy-drama film produced by Kenneth `` Babyface '' Edmonds , Tracey Edmonds and Robert Teitel and released by Fox 2000 Pictures.

Anne Rice was born in New Orleans and spent much of her early life there before moving to Texas, and later to San Francisco. Route 495 is a 3.45 mi freeway in Hudson County, New Jersey, in the United States that connects the New Jersey Turnpike (Interstate 95, I-95) at exits 16E and 17 in Secaucus to New York State Route 495 (NY 495) inside the Lincoln Tunnel in Weehawken, providing access to Midtown Manhattan.
Telemundo is an American Spanish-language terrestrial television network owned by Comcast through the NBCUniversal division NBCUniversal Telemundo Enterprises.

Damon Albarn was raised in Leytonstone, East London and around Colchester, Essex. He attended the Stanway School, where he met Graham Coxon and eventually formed Blur, whose debut album Leisure was released in 1991 to mixed reviews. The band released their self-titled debut album in 2001 to worldwide success. His debut solo studio album Everyday Robots was released on 28 April 2014 and featured collaborations with Brian Eno, Natasha Khan and the Leytonstone City Pentecostal Mission Church Choir.
Mogadishu, known locally as Hamar, is the capital and most populous city of Somalia. Many important national institutions are based in Mogadishu.
"Happiness in Slavery" is a song by American industrial rock band Nine Inch Nails from their debut extended play (EP), Broken (1992).
Andrew Kevin Walker (born August 14, 1964) is an American BAFTA-nominated screenwriter.

Shooter (2007 film) follows Force Recon veteran Bob Lee Swagger (Mark Wahlberg), who is framed for murder by a rogue secret private military company unit. The show Shooter (TV series) stars Ryan Phillippe in the lead role of Bob Lee Swagger, an expert marksman living in exile who is coaxed back into action after learning of a plot to kill the president.
House (also called House, M.D.) is an American television medical drama that ran on the Fox network for eight seasons, from November 16, 2004 to May 21, 2012.

Charles Manson was found guilty of first-degree murder and conspiracy to commit murder for the deaths of seven people, including Sharon Tate. Manson also received first-degree murder convictions for the deaths of Gary Hinman and Donald `` Shorty '' Shea. Recordings of songs written and performed by Manson were released commercially after he was charged with the crimes.

Sean Justin Penn, born August 17, 1960, is an American actor, filmmaker, and political activist. He began his acting career in television in 1974. He had his film debut in 1981. Penn became a prominent leading actor with the drama Dead Man Walking (1995). He won his first Academy Award for Best Actor in 2003 for Mystic River and a second one in 2008 for Milk.

Sir Donald George `` Don '' Bradman , often referred to as `` The Don '' , was an Australian cricketer, widely acknowledged as the greatest batsman of all time. Bradman acted as an administrator, selector and writer for three decades following his retirement.
L.A. Reid has served as the chairman and CEO of Epic Records, the president and CEO of Arista Records, and the chairman and CEO of the Island Def Jam Music Group.

Brad Wilk is best known as the drummer of the rock bands Rage Against the Machine (1991 -- 2000; 2007 -- 11) and Audioslave (2001 -- 07). He started his career as a drummer for Greta in 1990, and helped co-found Rage with Tom Morello and Zack de la Rocha in August 1991. As of 2016, he is playing in the band Prophets of Rage, with Commerford, Morello, Chuck D, B-Real and DJ Lord. Rage is a German heavy metal band, formed in 1984 by Peter ``Peavy'' Wagner.

The multi-camera series The Millers aired from October 3, 2013 to July 18, 2015 and ran 34 episodes over two seasons on CBS. CBS announced the cancellation of The Millers on November 14, 2014, four episodes into the show's second season.

Dorothy Ann Willis Richards (September 1, 1933 -- September 13, 2006) was an American politician and the 45th Governor of Texas from 1991 to 1995. She was a Democrat and was defeated for re-election in 1994 by George W. Bush. Richards was the second female governor of Texas. Ann Richards (October 1, 1935 -- April 1, 1982) was an American jazz singer and the wife of pianist Stan Kenton.
Drake Bell released an EP in 2011 called A Reminder independently.

Boardwalk is a 1979 American drama film written by Stephen Verona and Leigh Chapman and directed by Verona. Janet Leigh (born Jeanette Helen Morrison; July 6, 1927 -- October 3, 2004) was an American actress, singer, dancer and author. She also wrote four books between 1984 and 2002, including two novels.

Simón José Antonio de la Santísima Trinidad Bolívar y Palacios, known as El Libertador, was a Venezuelan military and political leader who played a leading role in the establishment of Venezuela, Bolivia, Colombia, Ecuador, Peru and Panama as sovereign states, independent of Spanish rule.

The Bermuda Triangle, also known as the Devil's Triangle, is a region in the western part of the North Atlantic Ocean where aircraft and ships are said to have disappeared under mysterious circumstances.

Colin Kaepernick became the 49ers' starter in the middle of the 2012 season after Alex Smith suffered a concussion. He led the 49ers to their first Super Bowl appearance since 1994, losing to the Baltimore Ravens. During the 2013 season, Kaepernick helped the 49ers reach the NFC Championship, losing to the Seattle Seahawks.
Marnie is a 1964 American psychological thriller film directed by Alfred Hitchcock.

Advertising is an audio or visual form of marketing communication that employs a nonpersonal message to promote or sell a product, service, or idea. It is communicated through various mass media, including old media such as newspapers, magazines, television, radio, outdoor advertising or direct mail; or new media such as search results, blogs, websites or text messages.
Private Lives is a 1930 comedy of manners in three acts by Noël Coward. Private Lives is a 1931 American Pre-Code comedy film directed by Sidney Franklin.

Maurice Harold Macmillan, 1st Earl of Stockton, (10 February 1894 -- 29 December 1986) was a British Conservative politician and statesman who served as the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom from 10 January 1957 to 19 October 1963.

Aristotle was an ancient Greek philosopher and scientist born in the city of Stagira. At seventeen or eighteen years of age, he joined Plato's Academy in Athens and remained there until the age of thirty-seven (c. 347 BC). Shortly after Plato died, Aristotle left Athens and, at the request of Philip II of Macedon, tutored Alexander the Great beginning in 343 BC.

David Mordechai Packouz, born February 16, 1982, is an American former arms dealer, musician, inventor and entrepreneur. Packouz invented a guitar pedal drum machine, the BeatBuddy, and is currently the CEO of music technology company Singular Sound.

Magic Johnson played point guard for the Lakers for 13 seasons. He was selected first overall in the 1979 NBA draft by the Lakers. He won a championship and an NBA Finals Most Valuable Player Award in his rookie season, and won four more championships with the Lakers during the 1980s. He retired again for four years, but returned in 1996, at age 36, to play 32 games for the Lakers before retiring for the third and final time. Johnson was named by Ebony magazine as one of America's most influential black businessmen in 2009 and has numerous business interests. He was a part-owner of the Lakers for several years.

Tenacious D is an American comedy rock duo formed in Los Angeles, California in 1994. The band is composed of Jack Black and Kyle Gass. They have released three albums: Tenacious D (2001), The Pick of Destiny (2006), and Rize of the Fenix (2012). The band gained popularity in 1997 when they starred in their television series.

James VI and I was King of Scotland as James VI from 24 July 1567 and King of England and Ireland as James I from 24 March 1603 until his death. He faced great difficulties in England, including the Gunpowder Plot in 1605 and repeated conflicts with the English Parliament.

Big Brother 2017, also known as Big Brother 18, is the upcoming eighteenth series of the British reality television series Big Brother, hosted by Emma Willis and narrated by Marcus Bentley. Marcus Morgan Bentley is a British actor, broadcaster and voice-over artist. Bentley is most famous for narrating the United Kingdom's version of the Dutch reality television programme Big Brother since its inception in 2000.

Saxony is a landlocked federal state of Germany. It is the tenth largest of Germany's sixteen states, with an area of 18,413 km2, and the sixth most populous, with 4 million people. Saxony is a region for quality wine in Germany. Together with the Saale-Unstrut wine region, Saxony is one of the northernmost wine regions in Europe.
East End Park is a former major league baseball park located in the East End neighborhood of Cincinnati in the United States. `` In the End '' is a song by American rock band Linkin Park.
Mel B. Brown began her solo career when she released "I Want You Back" with Missy Elliott on Virgin Records.
Noah Cyrus is the youngest daughter of Billy Ray Cyrus and younger sister of Miley Cyrus and Trace Cyrus.

Mohra (Pawn) is a 1994 Indian action thriller film directed by Rajiv Rai starring Akshay Kumar, Sunil Shetty, Raveena Tandon and Naseeruddin Shah. The film was released on 1 July 1994 and became the second highest grossing Indian film of 1994. The film got nine Filmfare nominations in 1995. Originally Divya Bharti was considered for the female lead, but after her death, Raveena Tandon was roped into the project as her replacement. The film is also remembered for its songs.
"Hourglass" is a song by British electronic duo Disclosure. "Hourglass" is singer-songwriter James Taylor's fourteenth studio album.

Shane Black (born December 16, 1961) is an American screenwriter, director, producer, and actor, known for writing the 1987 action film Lethal Weapon, and his directorial debut with the film Kiss Kiss Bang Bang in 2005.
A View to a Kill (1985) is the fourteenth spy film of the James Bond series, and the seventh and last to star Roger Moore as the fictional MI6 agent James Bond.

Papua is the largest and easternmost province of Indonesia, comprising most of western New Guinea. It was formerly called Irian Jaya (before that West Irian or Irian Barat) and comprised all of Indonesian New Guinea.
Augustus probably died from natural causes, although there were unconfirmed rumors that his wife Livia poisoned him.

Jennifer Lopez entered the music industry in 1999 with her debut studio album On the 6. In 2001, she became the first woman to have a number one album and film in the same week. Her third studio album, This Is Me ... Then (2002), was influenced by her relationship with Ben Affleck. She married Marc Anthony and gave birth to twins in 2008. In 2011, she returned to prominence as a judge on American Idol and with her single `` On the Floor ''.

A working animal is a domesticated animal kept and trained by humans to perform tasks. They may be family members, provide tractive force, or be used for milking or herding. Wild animals may be trained to perform work, but often lack the traits of a domesticated working animal.

Billboard Dad is a 1998 American direct-to-video comedy film directed by Alan Metter starring Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen. Top Latin Albums is a record chart published by Billboard magazine and is labeled as the most important music chart for Spanish language, full-length albums in the American music market. The Regional Mexican Albums is a genre-specific record chart published weekly by Billboard magazine in the United States.

Vedam is a 2010 Telugu language Indian drama film written and directed by Radhakrishna Jagarlamudi, starring Allu Arjun, Manoj Manchu, Anushka Shetty, Manoj Bajpayee, Saranya Ponvannan, Deeksha Seth, Lekha Washington, and Siya Gautham.
Men in Black II is a 2002 American science fiction action comedy film starring Tommy Lee Jones, Will Smith, Lara Flynn Boyle, Johnny Knoxville, Rosario Dawson, Tony Shalhoub and Rip Torn.
Sancho Panza is a fictional character in the novel Don Quixote written in 1605. Sancho acts as squire to Don Quixote and provides comments throughout the novel.
The Adventures of Pluto Nash is a 2002 Australian-American science fiction action comedy film starring Eddie Murphy (in a dual role) and directed by Ron Underwood.
Hedda Gabler premiered on 31 January 1891 at the Residenztheater in Munich. Ibsen was present at the world premiere.
Brazzers is a pornographic production company based in Montreal, Canada.
Timothy Simon Roth was born on 14 May 1961. He is an English actor and director.

Juventus Football Club S.p.A., known as Juve, is a professional Italian association football club based in Turin, Piedmont. It was founded in 1897 by a group of young Torinese students. The club is the second oldest of its kind still active in the country after Genoa's football section (1893). It has worn a black and white striped home kit since 1903 and has played its home matches in several grounds, being the latest the 41,507-capacity Juventus Stadium.

Viola Davis played supporting and minor roles in several films and television series in the late 1990s and early 2000s, including the films Kate & Leopold (2001) and Far from Heaven (2002), and the television series Law & Order: Special Victims Unit.

Jenna Jameson (born April 9, 1974) is an American entrepreneur, webcam model and former pornographic film actress. She started acting in erotic videos in 1993 after having worked as a stripper and glamor model.
The New Orleans Pelicans compete in the National Basketball Association (NBA) as a member club of the league's Western Conference Southwest Division.

Starrcade was an annual professional wrestling event held from 1983 to 2000 by the National Wrestling Alliance (NWA) and later World Championship Wrestling (WCW). Starrcade (1985) was the third annual Starrcade professional wrestling event produced by Jim Crockett Promotions (JCP) under the National Wrestling Alliance (NWA) banner. Starrcade (1987) was the fifth annual Starrcade professional wrestling event produced by Jim Crockett Promotions (JCP) under the National Wrestling Alliance (NWA) banner. Starrcade (1997) was the fifteenth annual Starrcade professional wrestling pay-per-view (PPV) event.

Jack Ryan Falahee, born February 20, 1989, is an American actor. He is known for his role as Connor Walsh on the ABC television legal drama How to Get Away with Murder, and for playing Benjamin Stringfellow on the PBS historical drama Mercy Street.

Seohyun is a South Korean singer and actress, born June 28, 1991. She debuted as a member of girl group Girls' Generation in August 2007. She debuted as a solo artist with her debut mini album, Don't Say No, on January 17, 2017.

The Apple II is an 8-bit home computer, one of the first highly successful mass-produced microcomputer products, designed primarily by Steve Wozniak. The Apple II series is a family of home computers, manufactured by Apple Computer and introduced in 1977 with the original Apple II. Stephen Gary Wozniak is an American inventor, electronics engineer, programmer, philanthropist, and technology entrepreneur who co-founded Apple Inc.

A&E is an American cable and satellite television channel. It is the flagship television property of A&E Networks, a joint venture between the Hearst Corporation and Disney. The Hearst Corporation and Disney each maintain a 50% ownership interest.

L.A. Reid has served as the chairman and CEO of Epic Records, the president and CEO of Arista Records, and the chairman and CEO of the Island Def Jam Music Group. He was also the founder and CEO of Hitco Music Publishing and the co-founder of LaFace Records.

Veeram ( Valour ) is a 2014 Indian Tamil action film directed by Siva and produced by Vijaya Productions. Veeram ( Valour ) is a 2016 Indian epic historical drama film written and directed by Jayaraj.

Home for the Holidays is a 1972 American made-for-television horror film directed by John Llewellyn Moxey, produced by Aaron Spelling and starring Sally Field, Eleanor Parker, Julie Harris, Jessica Walter and Walter Brennan which premiered on ABC on November 28, 1972. Home for the Holidays (1995 film) stars Holly Hunter, Robert Downey Jr., Anne Bancroft, Charles Durning, Dylan McDermott, Geraldine Chaplin, Steve Guttenberg, Cynthia Stevenson, Claire Danes, Austin Pendleton and David Strathairn.
Taran Hourie Killam (born April 1, 1982) is an American actor, comedian, and writer.

The Sex Factor is an online reality TV series produced by xHamster where eight men and eight women compete to become a porn star. XHamster produces The Sex Factor, a reality series in which men and women compete to become porn stars.
John Hovig Dolmayan, born July 15, 1973, is a Lebanese-born Armenian-American songwriter and drummer.
Island Records is a British-American record label that operates as a division of Universal Music Group ( UMG ) .
Sikkim is a northeastern state of India.
Christa McAuliffe took a teaching position as a social studies teacher at Concord High School in New Hampshire in 1983.
Ronald Bilius `` Ron '' Weasley is a fictional character in J. K. Rowling 's Harry Potter series.
Reign Over Me is a 2007 American drama film written and directed by Mike Binder, and produced by his brother Jack Binder. It was distributed by Columbia Pictures and released on March 23, 2007.
Colin Rand Kaepernick, born November 3, 1987, is an American football quarterback who is currently a free agent.

In 2016, Sheryl Lee appeared in Café Society and reprised her role of Laura Palmer in the Showtime revival of Twin Peaks (2017). In 2016 Sheryl Lee Ralph played Madame Morrible in Wicked on Broadway.
Matteo Renzi was born on 11 January 1975. He is an Italian politician who served as the Prime Minister of Italy from February 2014 until December 2016.
The film stars Kevin Kline, Kenneth Branagh, Armand Assante, Jim Cummings, Edward James Olmos, Tobin Bell and Rosie Perez.

"Same Old Love" is a song by American singer Selena Gomez from her second studio album, Revival (2015). In 2015, she released her second solo album, Revival, which debuted at number one on the Billboard 200. The first three singles, "Good for You," "Same Old Love," and "Hands to Myself," all topped the Mainstream Top 40 chart in the United States.
Weekly Idol is hosted by comedian Jeong Hyeong-don and rapper Defconn.

Heavy metal is a genre of rock music that developed in the late 1960s and early 1970s, largely in the United Kingdom and the United States. Bands in the new wave of British heavy metal such as Iron Maiden and Saxon followed in a similar vein beginning in the late 1970s.
Ashton Kutcher appeared in romantic comedies including Guess Who (2005), A Lot Like Love (2005), What Happens in Vegas (2008), and No Strings Attached (2011).

Topman is part of the Arcadia Group, which also owns Burton, Miss Selfridge, Wallis, Evans and Dorothy Perkins. Topman has a chain of high-street men's clothing stores located throughout the United Kingdom and has a presence on just about every UK High Street, and in Ireland main street outlets in six cities and towns.

At the dawn of the Industrial Revolution, the mining and metallurgical industries transformed Wales from an agricultural society into an industrial nation. The South Wales Coalfield caused a rapid expansion of Wales' population.
Tool has won three Grammy Awards, performed worldwide tours, and produced albums topping the charts in several countries.

YouTube is an American video-sharing website headquartered in San Bruno, California. The website is ranked as the second most popular site in the world by Alexa Internet, a web traffic analysis company.
Sidse Babett Knudsen was born on 22 November 1968. She is a Danish actress who works in theatre, television, and film.

Conrad Dunn began his screen career with the role of Francis `` Psycho '' Soyer in Stripes (1981). Several actors including John Larroquette, John Diehl, Conrad Dunn and Judge Reinhold were featured in their first significant film roles.
Raees stars Shah Rukh Khan, Mahira Khan and Nawazuddin Siddiqui.
Asylum Records is an American record label founded in 1971 by David Geffen and partner Elliot Roberts.
Trollhunters is an American computer-animated fantasy television series created for Netflix by Guillermo del Toro and produced by DreamWorks Animation and Double Dare You.

The Armenian Genocide, also known as the Armenian Holocaust, was the Ottoman government's systematic extermination of 1.5 million Armenians, mostly Ottoman citizens within the Ottoman Empire and its successor state, the Republic of Turkey. Morse code transmits text information as a series of on-off tones, lights, or clicks. Volcanic outgassing created the primordial atmosphere and then the ocean. The atmosphere contained almost no oxygen. Homer is the name ascribed by the ancient Greeks to the author of the Iliad and the Odyssey. The Thicket is a mystery/suspense novel written by American author Joe R. Lansdale.
Christopher Scott Kyle was a United States Navy SEAL veteran and sniper. On February 2, 2013, Kyle was murdered by Eddie Ray Routh at a shooting range near Chalk Mountain, Texas.

Audioslave was a four-piece band with Chris Cornell, Tom Morello, Tim Commerford, and Brad Wilk. Brad Wilk is known as the drummer of Rage Against the Machine and Audioslave. Rage Against the Machine was formed in 1991 and consists of Zack de la Rocha, Tim Commerford, Tom Morello, and Brad Wilk.

Janelle Monáe Robinson (born December 1, 1985) is an American singer, songwriter, actress, and model signed to Wondaland Arts Society and Atlantic Records. In 2010, Monáe released her first full-length studio album, The ArchAndroid, which was released by Bad Boy Records.
Winter's Tale is a 1983 novel by Mark Helprin.

Lake Providence is a town in and the parish seat of East Carroll Parish in northeastern Louisiana, United States. About 55 percent of its undergraduates and 60 percent overall come from Mississippi, and 23 percent are minorities; international students come from 90 nations.
In July 2016, the series was renewed for a six-episode second season, which is scheduled to premiere on June 2, 2017.

Aaron Burr was elected twice to the New York State Assembly (1784-1785, 1798-1799), was appointed New York State Attorney General (1789-1791), was chosen as a U.S. senator (1791-1797) from the State of New York, and reached the apex of his career as vice president.

Soyuz is a series of spacecraft designed for the Soviet space program by the Korolyov Design Bureau in the 1960s that remains in service today. It was commissioned to launch Soyuz spacecraft as part of the Soviet human spaceflight program, first with 8 unmanned test flights, followed by the first 19 manned launches. The Soyuz succeeded the Voskhod spacecraft and was originally built as part of the Soviet manned lunar programs.
Steve Ditko studied under Batman artist Jerry Robinson at the Cartoonist and Illustrators School in New York City.

Rage Against the Machine broke up due to tensions in the band, and de la Rocha started a solo career. The rest of the band formed Audioslave with Chris Cornell. Rage Against the Machine announced a reunion in 2007. Renegades is the fourth studio album by Rage Against the Machine, released on December 5, 2000.

The S&P BSE SENSEX, also called the BSE 30 or simply the SENSEX, is a free-float market-weighted stock market index of 30 well-established and financially sound companies listed on Bombay Stock Exchange. Tata Motors is listed on the Bombay Stock Exchange, where it is a constituent of the BSE SENSEX index, the National Stock Exchange of India, and the New York Stock Exchange.

Vietnam, officially the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, is the easternmost country on the Indochina Peninsula in Southeast Asia. It has an estimated 92.7 million inhabitants, making it the world's 14th-most-populous country. Vietnam is bordered by China, Laos, Cambodia, Thailand, the Philippines, Malaysia and Indonesia. Since 2000, Vietnam's economic growth rate has been among the highest in the world. Vietnam remains one of the world's four remaining one-party socialist states officially espousing communism.
Dreamer is a 2005 American sports drama film written and directed by John Gatins in his directorial debut.

Bhagat Singh (March 23, 1931) was an Indian socialist revolutionary whose acts of violence against the British in India and execution at age 23 made him a folk hero of the Indian independence movement. Bhagat Singh became a popular folk hero after his death.
Aparshakti Khurana made his Bollywood debut with Aamir Khan's ``Dangal''. Dangal is a 2016 Indian Hindi-language biographical sports drama film directed by Nitesh Tiwari.

James VI and I was King of Scotland as James VI from 24 July 1567 and King of England and Ireland as James I from 24 March 1603 until his death. The kingdoms of Scotland and England were individual sovereign states, though both were ruled by James in personal union. He was a major advocate of a single parliament for England and Scotland. James VI and I faced many difficulties with Parliament during his reign in England.

Danielle Cormack (born 26 December 1970) is a stage and screen actress from New Zealand. She was one of the original core cast of the soap opera Shortland Street. She is also known for her role as the Amazon Ephiny in the television series Xena: Warrior Princess, Cynthia Ross in The Cult, and Shota in Legend of the Seeker. Her most notable work in recent years was her portrayal of Bea Smith in the Foxtel prison drama Wentworth, in which she starred for four years before leaving the show in 2016.
Rob Sheridan (born October 11, 1979) is an American graphic designer, director, and photographer best known for his work with the band Nine Inch Nails.

David Spade starred and co-starred in the films Tommy Boy, Black Sheep, Joe Dirt, Joe Dirt 2: Beautiful Loser, Grown Ups, and Grown Ups 2, among others. Joe Dirt 2: Beautiful Loser is a 2015 American comedy film directed by Fred Wolf and written by David Spade and Fred Wolf.
Angela Evelyn Bassett (born August 16, 1958) is an American actress.

Artpop received mixed reviews but was commercially successful, debuting at number one on the United States Billboard 200 with first-week sales of 258,000 copies. It was Gaga's second consecutive number-one record in the United States and sold 757,000 copies. Artpop was the ninth best-selling album of 2013 with 2.3 million copies worldwide.

2006 saw the release of John Frusciante's fifth and final album with the Chili Peppers, Stadium Arcadium. The album is also the group's last to feature guitarist John Frusciante, who confirmed his departure from the band in 2009.

Margaret Thatcher was Prime Minister and implemented policies known as Thatcherism. She was a controversial figure and has been lauded as one of the greatest and most influential politicians in British history.

Michael Andrew `` Duff '' McKagan (born February 5, 1964) is an American musician, singer, songwriter and author. He has written weekly columns on a wide variety of topics for SeattleWeekly.com, Playboy.com, and ESPN.com.
Tom Baker is an English actor. He has narrated commercials, video games, audiobooks, and television series.

Valencia is the capital of the autonomous community of Valencia and the third largest city in Spain after Madrid and Barcelona, with around 800,000 inhabitants in the administrative centre. Valencia is Spain's third largest metropolitan area, with a population ranging from 1.7 to 2.5 million. The Valencian Community is an autonomous community of Spain. Its homonymous capital Valencia is the third largest city and metropolitan area in Spain.
Buffy Summers was portrayed by Kristy Swanson in the film and by Sarah Michelle Gellar in the television series.
The series "Make It or Break It" ended and the third season was the final season. The series finale aired on May 14, 2012.

Speech recognition is a sub-field of computational linguistics that develops technologies that enable the recognition and translation of spoken language into text by computers. Speech recognition applications include voice user interfaces such as voice dialing, call routing, domotic appliance control, search, simple data entry, preparation of structured documents, speech-to-text processing, and aircraft. The worldwide industry adoption of deep learning methods in designing and deploying speech recognition systems is evidence of advances in the field.

Richard Alf (January 26, 1952 -- January 4, 2012) was an American businessman and former comic book store owner who co-founded the San Diego Comic-Con International and served as its chairman beginning in 1970. San Diego Comic-Con was founded as the Golden State Comic Book Convention in 1970 by a group of San Diegans that included Shel Dorf, Richard Alf, Ken Krueger and Mike Towry. It was later called the `` San Diego Comic Book Convention ''.
Fist of Legend is a remake of the 1972 Fist of Fury, which starred Bruce Lee.

Dubuisson carded a 67 to tie with Van Zyl on 16 under par. McIlroy carded a third straight five under-par 67 to move to 15 under par with Aphibarnrat. McIlroy's round included an eagle on the 12th. McIlroy was level par for the day after 10 holes, but hit back with a birdie on the par-five 11th and an eagle on the 13th. He ruptured a ligament in his left ankle in July. He is targeting a third Race to Dubai title in four years and leads Willett by 271,214 points with three events remaining after the Turkish Open. Wood (-13) and Bland (-12) are fifth and seventh respectively.

Sheikh Ali Salman told the BBC that for national dialogue to be meaningful, the government had to show its willingness to offer "concrete solutions". Crown Prince Salman al-Khalifa is seen as a reformist. Hardliners are said to be opposed to a dialogue process. Sheikh Salman insisted that now was the time for dialogue. The al-Wefaq leader acknowledged that many young protesters had lost faith in the main opposition parties. Sheikh Salman noted that hours before King Hamad brought in Gulf Co-operation Council (GCC) troops to restore order and crush dissent on 14 March 2011, the crown prince and opposition had agreed a seven-point plan that would have moved Bahrain towards a constitutional monarchy. Sheikh Salman said he was "hopeful" that Senator John Kerry would "do more than his predecessor", Hillary Clinton. The al-Wefaq leader said that the UK government needs to speak out publically. Sheikh Salman also reiterated al-Wefaq's position that it would continue to call for "peaceful demonstrations". He also called for the release of 13 opposition leaders and human rights activists.

Christopher Hogwood died at his home in Cambridge following an illness lasting several months. His funeral will be private, with a memorial service to be held at a later date. He founded the Academy of Ancient Music (AAM) in 1973 and directed the academy across six continents for some 30 years. The AAM made more than 200 CDs. He studied keyboard at Cambridge University and his first positions were as a keyboard player and musicologist with the Academy of Saint Martin-in-the-Fields. He was the artistic director of the King's Lynn Festival and Boston's Handel and Haydn Society. He was also a tutor at Harvard University, honorary professor of music at the University of Cambridge and a professor-at-large at Cornell University in the US.

In the year to the end of March, 57 homicide victims were recorded, which is down five from the previous 12 months. This is the lowest number of recorded homicide cases for a single 12-month period since 1976. A sharp instrument remained the most common method of killing in Scotland and accounted for 51% of homicides (29 cases) in 2015-16. 31% (20 people) of the accused were identified by the police as being under the influence of alcohol or alcohol and drugs.
Bournemouth lost 2-1 to Sunderland. Dan Gosling scored Bournemouth's first goal in three games. Bournemouth had enough chances to win three games.

Mr. Abbott said the only way to prevent people dying at sea was to "stop the boats". Australia detains migrants trying to reach its shores by boat and takes them to offshore processing camps. The New York Times described the policy as "brutal" and "inhumane". Mr. Abbott said the image of Alan Kurdi was "very sad" and that Australia has stopped illegal boats. Mr. Abbott angered Australian Jewish groups by saying IS was worse than the Nazis. The Executive Council of Australian Jewry said the comment was "injudicious and unfortunate". Mr. Abbott later said he stood by his comments.

Washington blamed Russia and the Syrian government for intensifying their attacks against civilians. The US warned it would halt the talks unless Moscow stops bombing the city of Aleppo. Russia said it regretted the US move, accusing it of shifting the blame for the collapse of last month's truce. The US is suspending its participation in bilateral channels with Russia. Moscow and Syrian President Bashar al-Assad's troops had been "targeting of critical infrastructure such as hospitals, and preventing humanitarian aid from reaching civilians in need. The two sides would keep talking about counter-terrorism operations in Syria to avoid unnecessary clashes.
